jobs.title: Business Analyst - Lead
jobs.description:
**Posted On:** 16 Feb 2026


**Location:** Noida, UP, India


**Company:** Iris Software


**Why Join Iris?**  

Are you ready to do the best work of your career at one of **India’s Top 25 Best Workplaces in IT industry**? Do you want to grow in an award\-winning culture that **truly values your talent and ambitions**?  

Join Iris Software — one of the **fastest\-growing IT services companies** — where **you own and shape your success story**.

**About Us**  

At Iris Software, our vision is to be our client’s most trusted technology partner, and the first choice for the industry’s top professionals to realize their full potential.
With over 4,300 associates across India, U.S.A, and Canada, we help our enterprise clients thrive with technology\-enabled transformation across financial services, healthcare, transportation \& logistics, and professional services.
Our work covers complex, mission\-critical applications with the latest technologies, such as high\-value complex Application \& Product Engineering, Data \& Analytics, Cloud, DevOps, Data \& MLOps, Quality Engineering, and Business Automation.  


**Working with Us**  

At Iris, every role is more than a job — it’s a launchpad for growth.
Our Employee Value Proposition, **“Build Your Future. Own Your Journey.”** reflects our belief that people thrive when they have ownership of their career and the right opportunities to shape it.
We foster a culture where your potential is valued, your voice matters, and your work creates real impact. With cutting\-edge projects, personalized career development, continuous learning and mentorship, we support you to grow and become your best — both personally and professionally.
Curious what it’s like to work at Iris? Head to this video for an inside look at the people, the passion, and the possibilities. Watch it here.**Job Description**
-------------------


**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Business Analysis \& Requirement Management:
* Act as a lead liaison with business stakeholders (including Risk Partners) to meticulously elicit, analyze, and document comprehensive business requirements and user stories for credit risk initiatives.
* Collaborate with Risk Managers to define Business Requirement Documents (BRD) and functional specifications for EWS and DP, covering both quantitative (e.g., financials) and qualitative (e.g., market news) triggers.
* Translate complex credit risk trigger logic and business rules into clear, actionable, and detailed specifications (e.g., BRDs, FRDs) for technical and development teams.
* Collaborate to identify and define critical credit risk triggers, breaches, and monitoring parameters.
* Credit Risk \& Regulatory Expertise:
* Actively analyze, enhance, and monitor applications designed for customer portfolio surveillance, tracking compliance, identifying potential risks, and escalating concerns to appropriate channels.
* Monitor portfolio performance to proactively identify potential defaults and collaborate with upstream teams and operations to address or fix identified gaps.
* Perform in\-depth data analysis to identify trends in borrower behavior, cash flow, and covenant compliance.
* Ensure all developed solutions and product features adhere strictly to Indian regulatory guidelines and audit mandates related to credit and lending.
* Ensure all early warning systems comply with internal policies and regulatory guidelines (e.g., Basel II/III/IV, IFRS 9\).
* Product Development \& Enhancement:
* Partner with technology teams to design, test, and implement automated early warning systems, dashboards, and reporting tools.
* Contribute to the successful development and enhancement of critical credit risk platforms from conceptualization to deployment.
* Data Analysis \& Integrity:
* Work closely with business stakeholders to analyze data, identify gaps, define data requirements, and ensure data integrity for credit risk reporting, trigger analysis, and regulatory submissions.
* Contribute to the development of robust reporting mechanisms and conduct thorough risk assessments to support informed decision\-making and regulatory compliance.
* Collaboration \& Testing:
* Liaise effectively between Credit Risk, Technology, Data Science, and Front Office teams to ensure seamless integration of risk monitoring tools.
* Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and post\-production validation of system enhancements.


Required Skills \& Experience:
**Experience:**  

* 10\+ years of proven experience as a Business Analyst within the financial services domain.
* Demonstrable experience working on lending/credit products, specifically from a product development or enhancement perspective.
* In\-depth, hands\-on experience and expertise with Early Warning Systems (EWS) and Drawing Power (DP) in a credit risk context.
* Minimum 3\-5 years of specific experience in Credit Risk Management, with a focus on portfolio monitoring, credit analysis, or risk analytics.
* Experience working in an agile development environment.
* Domain Knowledge:
* Solid understanding of credit risk principles, financial products, and the entire credit lifecycle.
* Solid understanding of financial statement analysis, credit modeling, and EWS methodologies (e.g., behavioral scoring).
* Mandatory: Comprehensive knowledge and practical application of Indian regulatory requirements and compliance standards for credit and lending.
**Mandatory Competencies**
--------------------------


BA \- Business Analyst \- Requirement Gathering
BA \- Business Analyst \- Root Cause Analysis (RCA)
BA \- Business Knowledge
BA \- Client Interaction
BA \- Create Specifications / BRD/ FRD
BA \- Domain knowledge
BA \- Estimation and Project Execution
BA \- Excel, macros, pivots
BA \- Functional testing
BA \- Presentations and Reports**Perks and Benefits for Irisians**

jobs.title: AVP / VP – Product & Technology Innovation
jobs.description:
**For the position of AVP / VP – Product Technology Innovation**

**Location:** Mumbai/Bangalore

**Reports to**: Chief Technology Officer

**Works closely with:** CEO, Marketing,Business Heads (BFSI, IAM, e‑Gov, Retail, Industrial Automation, Smart Manufacturing, ESS)

**Being the AVP / VP – Product Technology Innovation for Group company, you will be responsible for**  

Owning discovery, product strategy and early‑stage R D for new solution and platform plays in biometric IAM, IoT/edge and ESS, from concept to validated proto/pilots. Drive IP and patent creation while shaping GTM narratives; hand over scaled execution to engineering and delivery teams.

 **The opportunity:**


This role provides a unique opportunity to shape Evolute’s next\-generation product platforms and innovation agenda, create defensible IP and convert emerging technologies into scalable solution platforms that drive new revenue streams across BFSI, IAM, e\-Gov, Retail, Industrial Automation, Smart Manufacturing and ESS domains. The role reports into the CTO and works in close collaboration with the CEO, Marketing leadership and Business Heads across BFSI, IAM, e\-Gov, Retail, Industrial Automation, Smart Manufacturing and ESS.

**Key responsibilities include:**

**1\. Product platform strategy (0 1\)**

* Define product vision and platform roadmaps for biometric IAM, IoT devices/platforms and ESS solutions across BFSI, e‑Governance, Retail, and Industrial/Smart Manufacturing segments.
* Identify high‑value problems and use‑cases with business heads and key customers, translate them into product hypotheses and experiment backlogs.
* Shape solution blueprints (hardware, firmware, cloud, analytics) that extend your current embedded‑hardware strength into full solutions and platforms.
* Deliver a targeted number of validated platform concepts taken to pilot per year.
* Drive adoption of new platforms across customer deals, increasing the share of platform\-led solutions vs bespoke hardware\-only solutions.

**2\. Research, feasibility and IP**

* Lead deep‑tech feasibility for new bets in AI/ML, biometrics, security, IoT/edge and ESS controls, balancing “Can we?” with “Should we build it?” from a commercial lens.
* Run structured PoCs and lab prototypes; define clear go/no‑go criteria and success metrics before scaling.
* Drive an IP pipeline around algorithms, architectures, and control schemes, coordinate invention disclosures, patentability checks, and filings with external counsel.
* Build a measurable IP funnel tracked through invention disclosures, patent filings and patents granted.

**3\. Go‑to‑market design (without full delivery ownership)**

* Craft positioning, value propositions, and solution narratives for each platform in partnership with Marketing and Sales.
* Define reference architectures, pricing logic and deployment models (on‑prem/edge/cloud, OEM/white‑label, managed service) for pilots and first‑wave customers.
* Support selected lighthouse deals with domain/solution expertise and proof‑points from pilots; hand execution to engineering and delivery once patterns are validated.
* Create a measurable new product/platform revenue pipeline from pilots and lighthouse deals**.**

**4\. Proto and pilot ownership (no BAU delivery)**

* Own the lifecycle from idea lab prototype limited customer pilots; ensure designs are secure‑by‑design and manufacturable.
* Work with Engineering Head to define clear handover criteria from pilot to scale (architecture baselines, backlog, documentation, non‑functional requirements).
* Stay involved post‑handover only as “platform owner” for roadmap and major architectural decisions, not day‑to‑day project management.

**5\. Collective decision‑making and governance**

* Run regular innovation/roadmap councils with CTO, CEO, Marketing and business heads to choose which bets to start, stop or scale.
* Maintain a simple portfolio view of innovation bets (stage, TRL, expected impact, risk) to guide investment decisions.
* Ensure compliance with biometric, KYC/AML, e‑Gov and IoT/ESS security guidelines in all concepts and prototypes.
* Track portfolio performance through pilot throughput, revenue pipeline, IP outcomes and platform adoption metrics.

**To qualify for the role, you must have** –

* 10–15\+ years across product, R D or platform roles in deep‑tech / embedded / IoT / ESS domains, with strong exposure to BFSI/IAM/e‑Gov and/or industrial/energy sectors.
* Proven 0 1 experience: has taken deep‑tech products from concept to successful pilots or early commercial rollout.
* Demonstrated IP orientation (patents filed/granted, or platforms with defensible technical moats).
* Strong systems thinking (hardware–firmware–cloud–data), excellent stakeholder facilitation with CXO and business heads, and comfort working in an MSME/startup environment.

**Key attributes for success –**

* Strategic thinking with strong commercial orientation.
* Ability to influence CXOs and business heads and drive cross\-functional alignment.
* High ownership mindset with comfort in ambiguity and early\-stage problem spaces.
* Strong governance, prioritization and decision\-making capability for innovation portfolios.

 **You will earn brownie points if you have –**

* Patents filed/granted or demonstrable IP\-led platforms with defensible technical moats.
* Experience working in MSME/startup or 0 1 innovation environments.
* Prior exposure to lighthouse customer pilots and early GTM motions for new platforms.

**Qualifications**
------------------


10–15\+ years across product, R D or platform roles in deep‑tech / embedded / IoT / ESS domains, with strong exposure to BFSI/IAM/e‑Gov and/or industrial/energy sectors.

jobs.title: Principal Product Manager, ASA
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Lead the transformation of enterprise decision\-making at Amazon by building the Amazon Sentiment Analyzer (ASA), a premier intelligence hub for Amazon’s senior leaders across the Stores and Devices Organization. As Principal Product Manager for ASA, you'll own the product strategy and execution for an intuitive interface that provides real\-time access to CX and business intelligence insights derived from over 5 billion customer, seller, and operational interactions annually. This is a high\-visibility role with exposure to Amazon's senior leadership, including VPs across retail categories, operations, and product teams. You'll be responsible for bridging the gap between leadership intuition and data\-driven evidence, enabling faster strategic decisions that directly impact customer experience.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Own the end\-to\-end product strategy for ASA, from current pilot phase through enterprise\-wide deployment across Amazon's leadership ecosystem
* Define and execute the product roadmap that transforms ASA into an essential daily workflow tool for senior leaders
* Drive the integration strategy with relevant tools, systems and processes to embed ASA into critical decision\-making forums
* Partner with senior leadership to identify high\-impact use cases and measure success through reduced decision\-making time and increased insight exploration
* Design and execute a comprehensive GTM strategy; Define success metrics and KPIs that demonstrate ASA's impact on decision\-making speed and quality
* Drive user research and feedback collection from senior leaders to continuously improve the conversational AI interface and insight delivery
**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 10\+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
* Experience owning feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
* Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
* Experience with end to end product delivery
* Experience as a product manager or owner
* Bachelor's degree in engineering, management, or technology

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience owning technology products
* Experience delivering results for large, cross\-functional initiatives/projects
* Experience in machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, statistics or natural language processing, or experience in computer architecture
* Experience working with technical and product stakeholders to define requirements, prioritize features, and influence product roadmaps

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.title: Senior Program Manager, RBS BQA
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


The job involves end to end business planning including but not limited to creating annual plans and strategy for execution, ensuring operational rigor, designing high business impact processes and identifying automation possibilities that drives process efficiency. As a large\-program owner, He/she will be the strategic point of contact to business, operations and tech teams of Amazon worldwide and must therefore be comfortable and confident liaising with remote global teams in business and technology at senior leadership levels. He/She will manage business impact via functional activities and will be accountable for designing and delivering on all KPIs of the same. He/she should define the program (mission, vision, tenets), set objectives, analyze data, drive improvements that are quantified with metrics, and influence resource allocation. He/She will solve ambiguous problems and proactively identify and mitigate risks (before they become roadblocks). He/She will be data\-driven and demonstrate good judgment in how and when to escalate.  

A successful candidate will be an exceptional strategic thinker. Key skills for the role include an extraordinary ability to deal with ambiguity, to network effectively and influence partner teams without authority, to overcome unforeseen obstacles, and a passion for developing a deep understanding of the tech product.  

  

This Senior Program Manager will own the VP goal to Improve Input vs Output vs Downstream impact metrics correlation of critical programs (Programs with VP\+ goals) to \>80% through Business Impact Analysis. This goal is critical as it assesses the capability of key programs to deliver committed goals, safeguarding RBS's reputation for delivering results and enabling programs to achieve excellence. The assessment and execution will be driven through a statistical and scientific framework to identify and mitigate business risks in goal delivery, thereby enhancing program capability.  

The manager will establish clear accountability structures, measure impact through the Connections Score and program\-specific KPIs, and coordinate cross\-functional execution to deliver impactful goals that directly correlate with improved organizational performance and deliverables  

  

Key job responsibilities  

As a Senior Program Manager, you will:  

  

1\) Own vision and definition for the Program  

2\) Own Planning, execution and OP contributions  

3\) Set and measurable goals for the team responsible
  

4\) Be responsible for end\-to\-end execution, engagement with global stakeholders \& collaboration with cross functional teams.  

5\) Define the clear requirement of specific business use cases for tech teams  

6\) Support data analysts and product managers by turning business requirements into functional specifications and then executing delivery.  

7\) Establish scalable, efficient processes for large scale implementation.  

8\) Own the execution strategy.  

9\) Develop strategies to mitigate risk.  

10\) Be responsible for all communication to Leadership (Flash updates, WBR, QBR, Deep dives).  

  

A day in the life  

* Leads strategic cross\-functional initiatives and defines multi\-year roadmaps aligned with business objectives
* Influences senior leadership through data\-driven insights and executive reporting
* Designs scalable frameworks and drives organizational change management
* Leverages GenAI technologies to transform operations—building AI\-powered solutions on platforms like Amazon QuickSuite for workforce optimization and automation
* Mentors teams while translating ambiguous challenges into structured programs with measurable impact

  

About the team  

Retail Business Service accelerates WW Amazon Stores growth by improving customer and Selling Partner experiences while optimizing costs. Our three\-fold charter: 1\) Detect and fix customer shopping impediments, 2\) Grow SP business profitably including scaled tier\-2/3 management, 3\) Reduce Cost\-to\-Serve across Stores P\&L. Business Impact Analysis (BIA) scientifically validates program stability through metric validation and statistical methodology including hypothesis testing, correlation analysis, regression modeling, and Pareto assessments. The process adequacy phase validates existing processes against desired outputs and identifies potential escalation risks using Risk Management systems. Gaps identified are prioritized by business criticality, driving actions to improve metric correlation and process adequacy, so programs achieve their defined goals.**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 5\+ years of working cross functionally with tech and non\-tech teams experience
* 5\+ years of program or project management experience
* 5\+ years of delivering cross functional projects experience
* Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements
* Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* 2\+ years of driving process improvements experience
* Master's degree, or MBA in business, operations, human resources, adult education, organizational development, instructional design or related field

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.title: Senior Manager - Training, Retail Business Services
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Amazon’s Retail Business Services (RBS) Learning \& Development (L\&D) is looking for well qualified and dynamic Learning professionals! The Senior Manager, L\&D will be responsible for executing the strategy for L\&D initiatives that support the business objectives of RBS. The Senior Manager, L\&D will lead the development of training best practices and standards, across all Business Units of RBS. The role is responsible for using the L\&D organization as a lever to solve complex instructional/learning challenges, develop and implement standard work practices and improve quality, and performance results with a focus on core learning programs (new hire onboarding, leader development onboarding, learning technology training), and Training Return on Investment (ROI). The Senior Manager, L\&D is responsible for executing train\-the\-trainer sessions in the Business Units to certify others as needed.
  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Actively seek, clarify and understand information from Business Units senior leaders that leads to an understanding of RBS performance, goals, required YOY improvements, trend analysis, and provide training assistance where necessary in order to achieve these goals
* Fully understand workflow, goals and reports used to drive the business
* React quickly and efficiently to production imperatives, scheduling conflicts and RBS wide rollouts
* Manage escalations and force multiplies by driving best practices standardization at scale and influence Learning adoption across all Business Units
* Aggregate and analyze Learning metrics to identify opportunities to support the Business Units with Learning products
* Partner with key business stakeholders to understand gaps in Learning programs and offer thoughtful, data\-driven solutions to business problems
* Partner with Program Managers on development and lead super regional implementation of training programs for managers, trainers, and others (i.e., participating in and conducting needs analysis, skills development classes, cross\-training, manager technical training, etc.)
* Foster the development and growth of Amazon employees (i.e., mentoring, teaching, etc.)
* Ensure that the Learning Department creates/updates accurate and useful information for training programs and other training documentation/aids
* Develop strategies and processes in partnership with other team leaders in RBS to ensure effective delivery of training programs for Leaders
* Create and manage the communication strategy for promoting and highlighting key training processes and initiatives across RBS
* Drive alignment to standardize learning solutions as well as gain feedback from the Business Units on opportunities for continuous improvement
* Actively develop the L\&D community by making customers and stakeholders aware of available instructional solutions

  

A day in the life  

The L\&D team is responsible for the successful orientation, training and coaching of all employees on cross\-department training needs/modalities. Through the L\&D team and other resources, this position will facilitate training initiatives and communicate policies to existing and new employees to ensure RBS performance goals are met and/or exceeded. This role entails providing strong leadership and direction to learning resources, trainers, across multiple regions.**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* 10\+ years of leadership development and training, to include organizational development, public speaking, and group facilitation experience
* Experience with project management


\- \- Knowledge of human resource theory, including employee relations, learning, and performance management  

\- \- Knowledge of GenAI and continuous learn as GenAi evolves  

\- \- Experience dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering measurable results in an agile environment  

\- \- Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to drive improvements  

\- \- Experience in instructional design, including needs analysis and multi\-media instruction  

\- \- Experience formulating and implementing training strategies, policies, and procedures for standardization and delivery of training methodology throughout the organization**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience implementing repeatable processes and driving automation or standardization

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
The Senior Product Manager holds the responsibility for designing, developing, and overseeing activities related to a specific product or a group of products within the Clearwater system. This oversight encompasses everything from defining the product and planning its development to production and go\-to\-market strategies. The Product Manager is tasked with crafting the product roadmap necessary to achieve bookings, client NPS, and gross margin targets associated with their component.
To facilitate organic growth, the Product Manager collaborates with internal stakeholders, clients, and prospects to identify new product capability requirements. They maintain close collaboration with their development teams to ensure the successful creation and introduction of these new capabilities to the market. Furthermore, the Product Manager takes charge of testing and implementing these fresh features with clients and actively promotes future growth to a broader audience of Clearwater clients and prospects.
Responsibilities:* Team Leadership: Lead a team of 8\-15 developers, providing guidance and support while participating in knowledge\-sharing and training initiatives to foster team effectiveness.
* Product Ownership: Own the product within the Clearwater system; responsible for the entire lifecycle from ideation to market launch.
* Backlog Management: Prioritize and manage the product backlog, ensuring alignment with business goals and stakeholder expectations.
* Requirement Definition: Define clear and comprehensive requirements for feature development, with occasional support from the lead.
* Collaboration: Work closely with development teams on the design and building of new features, ensuring they meet client needs and market demands.
* Roadmap Creation: Develop and communicate the product roadmap, setting strategic direction for future enhancements and features.
* Stakeholder Communication: Maintain regular communication with stakeholders regarding product updates, roadmap progress, and functionality releases.
* Client Engagement: Actively engage with clients to understand their use cases and future needs, translating insights into actionable product enhancements.
* Success Measurement: Measure and analyze the success of new feature releases, using data\-driven insights to inform future product decisions.
* Subject Matter Expertise: Act as a subject matter expert in alternative investments, providing insights and support to the sales team and contributing to product strategy.
* Employee Engagement: Participate in large\-scale initiatives aimed at promoting employee retention or engagement, contributing to a positive workplace culture.
* Process Improvement: Teach and guide other teams towards effective processes and best practices to enhance overall productivity and collaboration.


Required Skills:* Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem\-solve effectively in ambiguous situations.
* Proven ability to collaborate across various organizational functions, including sales, product management, operations, and technology.
* In\-depth knowledge of Private Markets, Private Equity, or Private Credit and a solid understanding of the financial services landscape.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and strong computer skills.
* Exceptional attention to detail, organizational skills, and documentation abilities.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts clearly.
* Strong interpersonal skills, demonstrating the ability to influence and engage stakeholders.
* Exceptional problem\-solving capabilities, particularly in a fast\-paced environment.
* Familiarity with Generative AI and agentic AI technologies.


Education and Experience:* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Engineering, Finance, or a related field.
* Minimum of 7\+ years of relevant experience in product management or related roles.
* At least 4\+ years of professional experience in Investment Management, Operations, or Accounting.
* Demonstrated experience in client engagement, with a focus on understanding and addressing client needs.
* Proven experience in data visualization and analytics.
* Experience in writing business requirements for a financial technology product or service.
* Prior experience delivering presentations to clients and internal stakeholders.
* Knowledge of Alternative Investments, including Private Equity, Limited Partnerships, Mortgage Loans, Bank Loans, or Derivatives.


Apply Now: If you are passionate about driving product innovation in the Alternatives Investments space, new technologies such as agentic AI, and have the experience and skills outlined above, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us at Clearwater in shaping the future of investment management products!

jobs.title: Senior Principal Consultant - DBA
jobs.description:
Ready to build the future with AI?  

At Genpact, we don’t just keep up with technology—we set the pace. AI and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. Genpact’s AI Gigafactory, our industry\-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. From large\-scale models to agentic AI, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges.  

If you thrive in a fast\-moving, innovation\-driven environment, love building and deploying cutting\-edge AI solutions, and want to push the boundaries of what’s possible, this is your moment.  

Genpact (NYSE: G) is an advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers lasting value for leading enterprises globally. Through our deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting\-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead. Powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation, our teams implement data, technology, and AI to create tomorrow, today. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook.  

Inviting applications for the role of Senior Principal Consultant \- DBA  

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DBA Lead for enterprise\-wide work initiatives, projects and provide solutions entire portfolio of products from mature to emerging technologies. The environment is dynamic and changes can be driven by technology advancements, Organizational objectives to improve efficiency and service levels via automation. This role requires deep technical expertise, strategic thinking, and the ability to collaborate with cross\-functional teams to drive efficiency and innovation.  

Responsibilities  

* Provide technical and consulting leadership in maintaining SQL Server as Primary skill, Oracle, Postgres and Mongo databases as secondary skills.
* Participate in planning efforts with stakeholders and IT groups.
* Analyze business process application requirements to produce formal analysis and design documents with minimal supervision.
* Provide cost/time estimates, capacity planning of database environments.
* Recommend changes/enhancements for improved systems availability, reliability and performance.
* Institute process for continuous improvement.
* Evaluate new technology from time to time to benefit the applications or administer database.
* Host meetings, provide guidance and support to R\&D/ DBA team.
* Assist on critical production issues, identify root cause and provide mitigation plan.
* Install and configure standalone SQL Servers and Always on clusters for Test, Dev, Staging and Production environment.
* Should have practical experience on MS SQL Server 2008/2012/2014/2016/2017 versions.
* Troubleshoot various problems that arise during SQL, service packs installations and fix the issues
* Plan and implement major upgrades, ensuring system integrity and monitoring
* Extensive hands\-on experience in Database migrations from lower to higher versions
* Evaluate and deploy security patches as necessary
* Review and deploy the scripts into the production.
* Own database maintenance plans, including rebuilding/reorganizing indexes, integrity checks, and others
* Experience with Enterprise environment change control procedure.
* Work with developers to improve database performance, slow running queries / processing
* Ensure high levels of performance, availability, sustainability and security
* Environments Setup High Availability as part Disaster Recovery Strategy for the Databases
* Good practical experience on Clustering, Always On, Database Mirroring, Log Shipping and Replication
* Implement and maintain database security
* Define and enforce database security best practices, including both user access and data at rest
* Create and configure a single and multi\-node SQL Server failover cluster instance
* Add or Remove Nodes in a SQL Server Failover Cluster


Qualifications we seek in you!  

Minimum Qualifications  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent education experience.
* Good years of MS SQL server experience in designing, implementing and administrating database system on multiple MS SQL Server versions from SQL 2005 to SQL 2019\.
* Thorough knowledge of SQL Server installation, configurations, troubleshooting, performance tuning skills required.
* Experience implementing and managing Windows clustering and AlwaysOn Failover Cluster Instances (FCI), Always\-On Availability Groups, Mirroring, Log shipping.
* Thorough knowledge of Windows, 2012, 2016 and preferable 2019\.
* Ability to diagnose problems and triage/resolve issues across various tiers (application, network, database, server, or storage tiers).
* Must have strong experience with TSQL, Powershell scripting.
* Ability to implement automation to reduce manual administrative tasks through use of jobs or other technologies.
* Experience in database upgrade/migrate, patching, backup recovery of large databases.


Preferred Qualifications/ Skills  

* Excellent problem\-solving and Good communication skills
  

Why to join Genpact?  

* Lead AI\-first transformation – Build and scale AI solutions that redefine industries
* Make an impact – Drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter
* Accelerate your career—Gain hands\-on experience, world\-class training, mentorship, and AI certifications to advance your skills
* Grow with the best – Learn from top engineers, data scientists, and AI experts in a dynamic, fast\-moving workplace
* Committed to ethical AI – Work in an environment where governance, transparency, and security are at the core of everything we build
* Thrive in a values\-driven culture – Our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness \- built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion \- allow your ideas to fuel progress


Come join the 140,000\+ coders, tech shapers, and growth makers at Genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: Up.  

Let’s build tomorrow together.  

  

Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.  

Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.
