jobs.title: Team Lead Business Operations
jobs.description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers \- amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life\-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility \- our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.


We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!


Job Description


MANAGER GEBS BUSINESS OPERATIONS


Noida


**Role Purpose:**

The "Team Lead Business Operations "is part of GEBS Business Operations. We work closely with our valued stakeholders (customers, distributor partners and country teams) to drive process optimization and enhancement, and own \& manage stakeholder/customer experience on every interaction in a fast paced, structured GSC environment, and reduce transactional efforts via effective and efficient processes which help to expedite issue resolution.


You will be reporting to MANAGER GEBS BUSINESS OPERATIONS.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for leading a team of GEBS Operations Logistics organization employees to ensure and effective completion of work
* Reduces customer efforts and enhances productivity via process improvements
* Drive process efficiency various CI \& Lean Methodologies
* Enable the ecosystem for potential automation
* Collaboration within department, maintaining a consistent information sharing process
* Collaboration with other departments to resolve complicated issues
* Providing timely feedback to the Team \& taking full responsibility including assessment, management and performance appraisals (PADR) of the team reporting to this position
* Taking the initiative to work with team to achieve business goals
* Enhances competency level in a planned manner
* Provide direction, assistance \& collaborates with Team Effectively
* Handles escalated customer issues and ensure resolution to these issues.
* Planning and executing in simple, effective ways to consistently achieve desired outcomes
* Takes responsibility for individual performance and aware of team performance goals
* Collaboration with other departments to resolve complicated issues
* Managing work flow and work schedules of the team
* Supportive of team decisions and is trusted by others
* Involved in various Projects and assisted Management in business operation

**Skills, Knowledge, Experience and Education**

* Full\-time Bachelor's Degree mandatory.
* Minimum 8 or more years of experience, working in a fast paced, high volume business environment
* Expertise with SAP – CRM, ERP, ECC
* Alternative Positioning and managing team
* Analytical and conceptual expertise
* MBA or similar professional qualification will be preferred
* Expertise in one or more of Rockwell Automation's business systems is required
* Working knowledge of web based tools is preferred

**Information Processing Capability (Factors of Complexity)**

* Drives the development and enhancement of measurement methodologies
* Planning, documentation, analysis and business requirements management techniques
* Administrative and reporting abilities
* Determine and drive processes which are best fit for Automation
* Contribute to the company knowledge base and process improvements
* Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information.
* Quality, on time delivery of agreed deliverables
* Ownership, Issue diagnosis, Resolution \& Next issue avoidance
* Managing work flow and work schedules of the team and prioritizing tasks
* Collaboration with team members and stake holders
* Owns business and technical requirements
* Clarifying a shared desired future with others and inspiring them to achieve it
* Attain results by feedback, Coaching and direction to team members
* Quality checks and training plan creation for team
* Advocacy \& Alternate Positioning
* Build Organizational Talent
* Provide input and recommendations to the Department Head
* Willingness for business travel.
* Capability of handling dynamic volume on real time basis
* Responsible for enforcement of project deadlines and schedules
* Maintain and drive high team morale
* Takes input from supervisor and appropriately and accurately applies comments/feedback
* Flexibility for working in different time zones, work from home as per business requirement
* Other duties to be assigned by Immediate Manager

**Key Performance Metrics**

* Continue globalization of Shared Services
* Ensure Process Transition is a low effort activity for our stake holders Process
* Ensuring Quality of transitioned/Sustaining existing processes
* Reduces customer efforts and enhances productivity via process improvements
* Identify and drives opportunities for Automation
* Improves process by partnering with in stakeholders/country teams
* Meet and drive respective operating/function KPIs
* Enhances competency level in a planned manner – Self Development

**What We Offer:**

Our benefits package includes …


* The ability to collaborate with, learn from colleagues in a complex, global organization.
* We provide a working environment with a creative company, paired with a great compensation package, great benefits, and a supportive atmosphere where you can sharpen with new challenges and development opportunities.
* Hybrid work\-from\-home and at a determined Rockwell Automation facility.
* Corporate Social Responsibility opportunities,
* Support from our 24/7 employee assistance program.

*We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.*

Rockwell Automation’s hybrid policy aligns that employees are expected to work at a Rockwell location at least Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays unless they have a business obligation out of the office.

jobs.title: Business Intelligence Engineer, RBS BE - BQA
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


We are looking for a customer\-obsessed Business Intel Engineer that thrives in a culture of data\-driven decision making who will be responsible to help us hold a high bar for RBS BQA  

  

Key job responsibilities  

This individual will be responsible for driving/creating:  

* Leveraging Generative AI tools and Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate data analysis, generate insights, and create natural language summaries of complex datasets
* Building and deploying GenAI\-powered analytics solutions to enhance self\-service capabilities and accelerate decision\-making
* Developing prompt engineering strategies and RAG (Retrieval\-Augmented Generation) pipelines to integrate GenAI with existing data infrastructure
* Experimenting with foundation models (e.g., Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker JumpStart) to solve business intelligence challenges
* Experience working with large, multi\-dimensional datasets from multiple sources
* Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve the operational and quality metrics.
* Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Tableau, Qlik, Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, etc.)
* Experience in deployment of Machine Learning and Statistical models
* Building new Python utilities and maintaining existing ones
* Enabling more efficient adhoc queries \& analysis
* Working closely with research scientists, business analysts and product leads to scale data
* Ensuring consistency between various platform, operational, and analytic data sources to enable faster and more efficient detection and resolution of issues
* Exploring and learn the latest AWS technologies to provide new capabilities and increase efficiencies
* Mentoring the team on analytics best practices

  

A day in the life  

* Working closely with cross\-functional teams including Product/Program Managers, Software Development Managers, Applied/Research/Data Scientists, and Software Developers
* Building dashboards, performing root cause analysis, and sharing actionable insights with stakeholders to enable data\-informed decision making


\- Leading reporting and analytics initiatives to drive data\-informed decision making\- Designing, developing, and maintaining ETL processes and data visualization dashboards using Amazon QuickSight  

* Transforming complex business requirements into actionable analytics solutions.

  

About the team  

Retail Business Service accelerates WW Amazon Stores growth by improving customer and Selling Partner experiences while optimizing costs. Our three\-fold charter: 1\) Detect and fix customer shopping impediments, 2\) Grow SP business profitably including scaled tier\-2/3 management, 3\) Reduce Cost\-to\-Serve across Stores P\&L  

RBS BQA transforms organizational capability through four pillars: Quality Assurance, People Excellence, Continuous Improvement, and Innovation. The team proactively solves internal challenges via systematic defect identification and data\-driven frameworks. Through various programs, BQA positions RBS as Amazon's benchmark organization.
**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 5\+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
* Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
* Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
* Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
* Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
* Experience developing and presenting recommendations of new metrics allowing better understanding of the performance of the business
* Experience writing complex SQL queries
* Bachelor's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field
* Experience in machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, statistics or natural language processing, or experience in developing and deploying LLMs in production on GPUs, Neuron, TPU or other AI acceleration hardware

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
* Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large\-scale, complex datasets
* Master's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field
* Experience with design \& innovation and research \& development

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.title: Senior Manager - Digital, Data & Analytics
jobs.description:
Welcome to Haleon. We’re a purpose\-driven, world\-class consumer company putting everyday health in the hands of millions. In just three years since our launch, we’ve grown, evolved and are now entering an exciting new chapter – one filled with bold ambitions and enormous opportunity.  

  

Our trusted portfolio of brands – including Sensodyne®, Panadol®, Advil®, Voltaren®, Theraflu®, Otrivin®, and Centrum® – lead in resilient and growing categories. What sets us apart is our unique blend of deep human understanding and trusted science.  

  

Now it’s time to fully realise the full potential of our business and our people. We do this through our Win as One strategy. It puts our purpose – to deliver better everyday health with humanity – at the heart of everything we do. It unites us, inspires us, and challenges us to be better every day, driven by our agile, performance\-focused culture.
Role Overview
The Senior Manager, Procurement Digital, Data \& Analytics a key contributor to the delivery of Global Procurement’s digital transformation \& analytics roadmap. This role will be responsible for driving Procurement transformation projects, from building the business case to implementation. This role requires strong knowledge of procurement/supply chain digital solutions, project management, drive for performance improvement, analytical skills, significant amount of internal engagement, utilizing strong interpersonal skills, and influence management.
In this role you will* Be leading Procurement transformation projects; operating in a fast\-paced environment that requires ability to seamlessly shift across a wide variety of responsibilities.
* Play a key leadership role in managing the delivery of the key Procurement transformation projects and support leadership in the development \& execution of Procurement technology roadmap.


Key Responsibilities* Lead high scale global procurement projects and manage end\-to\-end aspects of global Procurement transformation initiatives including right from identifying problem statements through stakeholder interactions, solution design, evaluating existing technology landscape, propose system changes \& enhancements, assess impact on user experience, process and cost.
* Perform business process mapping, process re\-engineering and gap analysis. Recommend digital procurement solutions or new age technologies to streamline, consolidate and optimize processes
* Support development of Procurement technology roadmap leveraging latest and best in class technology to support business requirement.
* Identify opportunities to automate processes by leveraging digital solutions like RPA, AI/ML and GenAI based business applications
* Development \& execution of Procurement technology and process transformation programme. Identify and implement applications that complement our existing technology landscape to enhance user experience, improve compliance and drive cost benefits.
* As a transformation SME you will be responsible to continuously evaluate and propose leading practice processes in procurement domains of category management, supplier relationship management, sourcing, contracting and operational purchase to pay
* Collaborate closely with the various stakeholders across the organization including but not limited to Finance, Tech, Procurement Professionals and Operations.
* Engage with Procurement, Finance Services, Technology organizations to gather business requirements and design the new business processes.
* Engage with Tech and 3rd party services organizations to design, implement and continuously improve the Guided buying module ensuring human\-centric and fit for purpose.


Qualifications \& Skills:* Bachelors \- Business, Supply Chain, Engineering, related field or any Bachelors, combined with relevant experience.
	+ Preferred: master’s degree (Procurement, Finance, Business or equivalent)
	+ Good to have: Procurement or related certifications (e.g., CPSM, CPIM, PMP)
* Industry\-leading knowledge of Ariba Guided buying, Source\-to\-Contract, SAP ECC \& P2P systems (Must be with SAP ARIBA).
* Experience of about 10\-15 years in global procurement P2P and Ariba implementations.
* Broad knowledge of end\-to\-end source\-to\-settle processes and ERP/Ariba functionality.
* High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office programs (e.g., PowerPoint and Excel)
* Demonstrated high learning agility; proven ability to solve complex problems with limited oversight.
* Strong analytical, written and verbal communications, and influencing skills. Specifically developing presentations and business cases for executive audiences
* Ability to work in high pressure environment, often under tight deadlines.

  

 Job Posting End Date  


2026\-03\-15  

Equal Opportunities
Haleon are committed to mobilising our purpose in a way that represents the diverse consumers and communities who rely on our brands every day. It guides us in creating an inclusive culture, where different backgrounds and views are valued and respected – all in support of understanding and best serving the needs of our consumers and unleashing the full potential of our people. It’s important to us that Haleon is a place where all our employees feel they truly belong.  

  

During the application process, we may ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. This information ensures we meet certain regulatory and reporting obligations and supports the development, refinement, and execution of our inclusion and belonging programmes that are open to all Haleon employees.  

  

The personal information you provide will be kept confidential, used only for legitimate business purposes, and will never be used in making any employment decisions, including hiring decisions.  

Adjustment or Accommodations Request
If you require a reasonable adjustment or accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at Haleon at any stage of the application process, please let your recruiter know by providing them with a description of specific adjustments you are requesting. We’ll provide all reasonable adjustments to support you throughout the recruitment process and treat all information you provide us in confidence.  

Note to candidates
The Haleon recruitment team will contact you using a Haleon email account (@haleon.com). If you are not sure whether the email you received is from Haleon, please get in touch.

jobs.title: Sports Director
jobs.description:
We are seeking a visionary Sports Director to lead our athletic department's long\-term strategy and daily operations. You will be the architect of our sporting vision, ensuring that high\-performance athletic goals align with financial sustainability and organizational growth.

jobs.title: Retail Sales Head-Jewellery
jobs.description:
Job Description – Sales Head

**Company:** Reputed Heritage Jewellery Brand  
**Reports To:** Director

About the Company

A heritage jewellery brand with over 88 years of legacy, renowned for authenticity, craftsmanship, and customer trust. With 12\+ showrooms and ambitious expansion plans across Maharashtra, the organization is on a journey of transformation – combining tradition with modern retail excellence.

Core values – Customer Orientation, Kaizen (Continuous Improvement), Quality, Teamwork, Respect for People, and Standards – guide every decision, ensuring sustainable and value\-driven growth.

Position Overview

We are seeking a Senior Sales Head with deep retail and leadership experience to drive exponential sales growth across the retail network.

The Sales Head will lead sales, showroom operations, and customer engagement strategy, ensuring consistent revenue growth, process discipline, and a premium in\-store experience across all branches.

This is a high\-impact leadership position offering a clear pathway to Chief Sales Officer (CSO) as the organization scales.

The role demands a high\-energy, customer\-centric leader capable of developing people, driving sales processes, and ensuring that every showroom achieves its full potential.

Key Responsibilities

1\. Sales Growth \& Strategy

* Develop and implement monthly and quarterly sales acceleration plans to achieve top\-line and profitability targets.
* Drive category\-wise growth (bridal, daily wear, silver, diamond) with data\-backed strategies and focused promotions.
* Set and monitor store\-wise sales targets, productivity ratios, and category performance benchmarks.
* Create monthly performance dashboards to track conversion, ticket size, and revenue growth trends.
* Benchmark against top regional and national jewellery brands for sales excellence and customer engagement.

2\. Showroom Performance \& Operations

* Conduct weekly branch performance reviews and audits to identify improvement areas.
* Standardize sales SOPs for greeting, needs assessment, product presentation, closing, and after\-sales follow\-ups.
* Partner with Marketing \& Visual Merchandising to ensure campaigns translate into measurable footfall and conversions.
* Strengthen cross\-store coordination for best practices and consistent customer experience.

3\. People Leadership \& Development

* Lead and mentor Showroom Managers and Sales Advisors to build strong teams.
* Design and deliver Sales Workshops across branches for continuous improvement in performance and customer service.
* Foster a high\-performance culture emphasizing discipline, ownership, and respect for people.
* Develop a succession pipeline for future showroom leaders.

4\. Marketing \& Customer Experience

* Partner with the marketing team to align promotional strategies with footfall and customer data.
* Leverage CRM analytics and purchase history to design targeted campaigns and loyalty programs.
* Ensure consistency in customer experience, packaging, and brand tone across all showrooms.
* Strengthen bridal and festive sales funnels, ensuring a superior in\-store journey.

5\. Data\-Driven Decision Making

* Implement Power BI/ERP\-based sales tracking dashboards integrated with organizational systems.
* Utilize analytics to optimize product mix, inventory turnover, and sales efficiency.
* Identify high\-performing SKUs and replicate successful patterns across branches.

6\. New Showroom Launches \& Expansion

* Prepare pre\-opening sales plans for new showrooms.
* Drive local marketing activations and customer acquisition efforts during launch phases.
* Build local market connect programs through community engagement and partnerships.

Qualifications \& Experience

* Graduate/Postgraduate in Business, Marketing, or Retail Management.
* 12–15 years of experience in sales leadership within jewellery, luxury retail, or FMCG sectors.
* Proven record of managing 10\+ retail outlets with measurable sales growth.
* Strong understanding of customer behaviour, merchandising, and store operations.
* Proficiency in ERP systems, Power BI, and CRM analytics.
* Marathi and English fluency preferred.

Key Competencies

* Strategic thinker with operational execution excellence.
* Strong leadership and motivational skills with focus on people development.
* Data\-driven decision\-making approach.
* Deep customer orientation and brand alignment.
* Integrity, ownership, and a Kaizen mindset toward continuous improvement.

Performance Metrics

* Revenue and margin growth (branch\-wise and overall).
* Conversion ratio, AOV (Average Order Value), and repeat purchase rate.
* Customer satisfaction and retention scores.
* Team productivity and training completion metrics.
* Inventory turns and category contribution.

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹1,800,000\.00 \- ₹2,400,000\.00 per year

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Director - Finance Digital Architect
jobs.description:
Location:
IN\_Bangalore\_Sattva Knowledge Court Bdg\_HII
Job Family:
Finance
Worker Type Reference:
Regular \- Permanent
Pay Rate Type:
Salary
Career Level:
M4
Job ID:
R\-51621\-2026
  
### **Description \& Requirements**

**Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive**


We’re a global, multi\-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast\-track your career.

* Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience
* Combine ingenuity, in\-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence
* Advance in\-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment

**About the Role**


We are seeking a visionary Finance Digital Leader with deep expertise in Finance data and systems architecture deployment. The Finance Digital Lead will play a pivotal role in driving HARMAN’s Finance Digital transformation. As an integral part of the Finance organization that role will be a strategic partner to both the Automotive Finance and Digital organizations. This role will drive the design, and help build along with Digital a scalable Finance Digital Ecosystem, integrating core platforms such as SAP, OneStream, IBP (Integrated Business Planning), Salesforce, best\-of\-breed analytics applications and Automation / AI deployments.


This leader will combine financial acumen, technology fluency, and process excellence to deliver a seamless digital backbone that enables real\-time insights, efficient processes, and strategic decision\-making across the enterprise.


Reporting to the Automotive Division Finance Head, this role is responsible for creating the digitized Finance vision, expand and drive the digitalization roadmap along with Digital. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of finance digital transformation implementing innovative solutions, leveraging S/4HANA, OneStream and leading teams to support strategic goals besides driving process changes and thinking of new ways of working in a digitalized finance function.

**What You Will Do**


Strategic Leadership

* Co\-create along with Digital a scalable digital finance strategy that enhances operational efficiency, drives automation of finance operations including shared services with SAP S/4HANA as the backbone. Prepare the finance digital ecosystem to be ready for additional expansion including M\&As.
* Partner with the senior leaders of Finance, Digital and other senior leaders to align \& drive digital finance initiatives with organizational priorities.


Finance Digitalization

* Ensuring seamless data flow across systems and eliminating redundancies. Understand the ‘why’ and ‘what’ needed for the finance digitalization transformation and work together with Digital on the how including evaluating and implementing digital solutions that reduce operational complexity, gives operational efficiency and improve time\-to\-close cycles for finance. Leverage existing the capabilities of the eco\-system to the maximum extent possible / best\-in\-class ways of working.
* Implement advanced analytics and reporting tools to deliver actionable insights and faster decision\-making for finance teams. Support a Business Self\-Service set\-up.
* Design and implement tools and frameworks to enable "what\-if" scenario modeling, sensitivity analysis, and long\-term forecasting including across Sales, Engineering and Supply chain controlling functions. Partner with FP\&A teams to refine financial models and work closely with Digital to integrate them into scalable technology solutions.
* Lead the streamlining and automation of shared service operations, focusing on accounts payable, accounts receivable, fixed assets, banking, payroll, reconciliation, and financial close processes. Implement robotic process mining and process automation (RPA), intelligent document processing, and workflow tools to drive efficiency and eliminate manual tasks. Identify and deliver on AI use cases especially the leverage of agents.


Architectural Leadership \& S4 HANA expertise

* Significantly contribute and partner closely with Digital leader to the implementation of a scalable finance system \& data architecture, aligned with end\-to\-end HARMAN Automotive Digital architecture.
* Serve as the organization’s SAP S/4HANA subject matter expert for Finance, ensuring optimal use of its capabilities across finance operations.
* Leverage S/4HANA’s advanced features, such as Central Finance, embedded analytics, and predictive insights, to support decision\-making, scenario planning and operational efficiency.
* Support the migration of legacy systems to S/4HANA, ensuring seamless integration and minimal disruption to operations.
* Understand business needs and drive needed integration of S/4HANA with other enterprise systems (e.g., Salesforce, Procurement, SIOP, PLM, Engineering Project Management) along with Digital to ensure seamless data flow and reporting.
* Collaborate with Digital to adopt cloud\-based platforms, APIs, and microservices that supports automation and analytics and scale to use of AI.
* Drive for global standard processes and adherence to them. Minimize customization to the must\-have. Drive documentation and roll\-out of process blueprints across countries and company codes.


Execution and Governance

* Prepare Finance Digital roadmap, lead the execution of Finance Digital initiatives closely partnering with Digital, ensuring alignment with business goals, timelines, and budgets.
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions, ensuring continuous improvement and adaptability.
* Act as a Business Integrator. Support the Finance function and their Business Partners identifying needs and translate them into requirements and actions on the Digital side. Recommend responses to identified business needs.


Team Leadership and Development

* Serve as a thought leader, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement with regards to a future fit digitized Finance organization,
* Establish clear goals, performance metrics, and accountability for the Finance Digital team and set expectations for the Finance counterparts in Digital.
* Foster cross\-functional collaboration between finance, Digital, and other functions to drive digital enablement.

**What You Need to Be Successful**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, with minor in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (master’s preferred).
* 10\+ years of experience leading finance technology deployment and driving finance digital transformation, with a strong focus on financial systems architecture and scenario planning.
* Dual fluency: Finance process authority \& systems/architecture ownership (ERP FI/CO (PC/PA), EPM, Finance Analytics).
* Deep expertise and experience in SAP S/4HANA, including its finance modules of FI/CO, FP\&A and reporting, financial planning tools, financial consolidation, and advanced analytics platforms.
* Ecosystem thinking: Integration across SAP / EPM (OneStream) / IBP / Salesforce) / BI to enable planning, forecasting, and performance management.
* Strong technical knowledge of Data lakes, Analytics and Automation technologies. Excellent problem\-solving skills.
* Analytics uplift: KPIs, self\-service dashboards, predictive modeling to support FP\&A and decisioning.
* Automation \& data quality: Process digitization, RPA/AI, master data and reporting standards.

**Bonus Points if You Have**

* SAP certifications (e.g., S/4HANA Finance, Central Finance, or Technical Architect).
* Knowledge of advanced technologies such as AI and machine learning in financial forecasting and operations.
* Strong change management skills to lead organizational transformation and adoption of new tools.
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and enterprise architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF).

**What Makes You Eligible**

* Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel.
* Be willing to work remotely and occasionally in an office located in US, Germany, or India
* Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen (US).

**What We Offer**

* Flexible work environment, allowing for full\-time remote work globally for positions that can be performed outside a HARMAN or customer location.
* Access to employee discounts on world\-class products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, and more)
* Extensive training opportunities through our own HARMAN University
* Competitive wellness benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program.
* An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development.


\#LI\-AR2


**You Belong Here**
HARMAN is committed to making every employee feel welcomed, valued, and empowered. No matter what role you play, we encourage you to share your ideas, voice your distinct perspective, and bring your whole self with you – all within a support\-minded culture that celebrates what makes each of us unique. We also recognize that learning is a lifelong pursuit and want you to flourish. We proudly offer added opportunities for training, development, and continuing education, further empowering you to live the career you want.

**About HARMAN: Where Innovation Unleashes Next\-Level Technology**
Ever since the 1920s, we’ve been amplifying the sense of sound. Today, that legacy endures, with integrated technology platforms that make the world smarter, safer, and more connected.  

  

Across automotive, lifestyle, and digital transformation solutions, we create innovative technologies that turn ordinary moments into extraordinary experiences. Our renowned automotive and lifestyle solutions can be found everywhere, from the music we play in our cars and homes to venues that feature today’s most sought\-after performers, while our digital transformation solutions serve humanity by addressing the world’s ever\-evolving needs and demands. Marketing our award\-winning portfolio under 16 iconic brands, such as JBL, Mark Levinson, and Revel, we set ourselves apart by exceeding the highest engineering and design standards for our customers, our partners and each other.  

If you’re ready to innovate and do work that makes a lasting impact, join our talent community today!  

  

**Important Notice: Recruitment Scams**
Please be aware that HARMAN recruiters will always communicate with you from an '@harman.com', ‘@careers.harman.com’ or ‘harmanglobal.avature.net’ email address. We will never ask for payments, banking, credit card, personal financial information or access to your LinkedIn/email account during the screening, interview, or recruitment process. If you are asked for such information or receive communication from an email address not ending in one of the above email domains about a job with HARMAN, please cease communication immediately and report the incident to us through: harmancareers@harman.com.  

HARMAN is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. HARMAN strives to hire the best qualified candidates and is committed to building a workforce representative of the diverse marketplaces and communities of our global colleagues and customers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.HARMAN attracts, hires, and develops employees based on merit, qualifications and job\-related performance.(www.harman.com)

jobs.title: VP - Process Reliability Platform
jobs.description:
Infinite Uptime is seeking a **VP of Process Reliability Products** to lead the strategy, development, and execution of products focused on process visualization, monitoring, and optimization for heavy process industries, including cement, steel, oil \& gas, mining, power generation, and chemicals.
This role will own the product portfolio that connects to PLCs, DCS, historians, and multiple data sources, transforming raw operational data into actionable process insights and optimization solutions that improve key manufacturing KPIs such as throughput, yield, quality, energy efficiency, emissions, and process stability.
You will guide a team of Product Managers and work closely with Engineering and AI teams to build scalable products that move customers from visibility prescriptive intelligence semi\-autonomous process optimization.**Key Responsibilities****1\. Product Vision \& Strategy*** Define and execute the product vision for:
* Process visualization \& dashboards
* Process analytics \& KPI management
* Prescriptive process optimization
* Decision support for operators and process engineers
* Build and own a multi\-year product roadmap aligned with:
* Manufacturing performance improvement
* Autonomous operations strategy
* Customer business outcomes
* Champion the evolution from process monitoring to closed\-loop optimization.

**2\. Heavy Industry Process Leadership*** Own industry\-specific process solutions for:
* Cement (kilns, mills, coolers, preheaters)
* Steel \& metals (furnaces, rolling mills, continuous casting)
* Oil \& gas (compressors, separation, refining units)
* Mining \& minerals (crushers, conveyors, grinding circuits)
* Power \& chemicals (boilers, turbines, reactors)
* Translate real plant challenges into scalable product capabilities:
* Process instability
* Energy inefficiency
* Yield loss
* Quality variability
* Environmental compliance risks

**3\. Data Connectivity \& Platform Integration*** Lead product strategy for connectivity to:
* PLCs, DCS, SCADA systems
* Historians (OSIsoft PI, AVEVA, Aspen, etc.)
* Edge devices and IoT sensors
* Enterprise systems (MES, CMMS, ERP where relevant)
* Ensure the platform supports:
* High\-frequency process data ingestion
* Secure OT/IT integration
* Scalable data pipelines
* Real\-time and batch analytics

**4\. KPI\-Driven Process Optimization*** Define and standardize KPIs for process improvement, including:
* Throughput \& capacity utilization
* Yield and quality consistency
* Energy consumption per unit
* Process stability \& variability
* Emissions and compliance metrics
* Build products that:
* Visualize KPIs clearly for operators and engineers
* Correlate process behavior with business impact
* Recommend actions to improve performance
* Support “what\-if” analysis and scenario modeling

**5\. Product Leadership \& Team Development*** Lead and mentor a team of Product Managers focused on:
* Process intelligence
* Visualization \& UX
* Optimization \& analytics
* Establish best practices for:
* Product discovery and validation
* Customer engagement
* Roadmap prioritization
* Outcome\-driven product metrics
* Build a culture of customer\-centric, data\-driven product development.

**6\. Customer \& Market Engagement*** Act as a senior product leader in customer interactions:
* Discovery sessions
* Executive briefings
* Solution demonstrations
* Work closely with Sales and Customer Success to:
* Drive product adoption
* Support enterprise deals in North America and Europe
* Shape industry\-specific solution messaging

**7\. Ecosystem \& Partner Strategy*** Define integration strategy with:
* Automation vendors (Siemens, Rockwell, Honeywell, Emerson, ABB, etc.)
* Data platforms and historians
* Industrial AI partners
* Enable partner and customer extensions on the process product platform.

**Success Metrics*** Adoption of process visualization and optimization products
* Measurable customer KPI improvements (energy, yield, throughput, stability)
* Revenue growth from process products
* Enterprise wins in heavy industries
* Time\-to\-value for deployments
* Strength and performance of product management team

**Required Experience \& Skills****Domain \& Industry Experience (Critical)*** 10–15\+ years in product management, engineering, or industrial digital solutions for process industries, including:
* Cement
* Steel \& metals
* Oil \& gas
* Mining
* Power generation
* Chemicals \& petrochemicals
* Strong understanding of:
* Process operations and workflows
* PLC, DCS, SCADA systems
* Industrial data historians
* Manufacturing KPIs and optimization techniques

**Technical \& Product Skills*** Experience building products involving:
* Industrial data ingestion \& connectivity
* Real\-time dashboards and visualization
* Process analytics and optimization
* AI/ML or advanced analytics for industrial use cases
* Secure OT/IT integration
* Comfortable working closely with:
* Engineering and data science teams
* Architects and platform teams
* Field operations and customers

**Leadership \& Communication*** Proven ability to:
* Lead and scale product teams
* Define vision and execute roadmaps
* Influence cross\-functional stakeholders
* Strong executive communication and presentation skills
* Experience working with enterprise customers in Global markets

**Preferred Background*** Experience at companies such as:
* Siemens, Rockwell Automation, Honeywell, Emerson, ABB, AVEVA, AspenTech, GE Digital
* Industrial AI or process optimization startups
* Exposure to:
* Advanced Process Control (APC/MPC)
* Digital twins and simulation
* Autonomous operations and closed\-loop optimization
* Edge and cloud industrial platforms


MBA or MS in Engineering preferred

jobs.title: Senior Salesforce Quality Assurance Engineer - Customer Support
jobs.description:
**Job Ad**
==========


We are seeking a Senior Salesforce Automation Quality Engineer with strong expertise in Salesforce Service Cloud testing and automation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing robust automation frameworks to ensure high\-quality Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud implementations.


Salesforce is critical to the success of our Sales, Customer Support, and Marketing teams, and you’ll play a key role in managing the quality of this system.


As a Salesforce Automation Quality Engineer, you’ll partner with Salesforce Developers, Administrators, and Revenue Operations Analysts to ensure the highest quality of our Go\-to\-Market systems. Successful candidates have experience administering Salesforce.com and have eagle\-eye attention to detail, and experience with ensuring Salesforce.com configuration and customizations are implemented correctly.


 We work with strict deadlines, so strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and exceptional time management and task execution skills are key.

**This position will report to the Senior Manager GTM Systems and will be based in our Pune, India, Procore office. We’re looking for candidates to join us immediately.**

**What you’ll do:**

* Design, develop, and execute automated and manual test cases for Service Cloud applications. Define and own test strategy, test plans, and test approach for Salesforce Service Cloud programs
* Validate Salesforce configurations, including flows, validation rules, security settings, OWD, profiles, roles, reports, dashboards, LWC, and Apex.
* Test core Service Cloud features, including Accounts, Contacts, Case Management, Omni Channel, Messaging\-InApp\-Webform (MIAW), LiveAgent, SLA, Entitlements, Knowledge Base, CTI Integration, and Qualtrics Survey
* Develop and maintain Salesforce automation frameworks. Execute and maintain automation scripts and integrate them with CI/CD pipelines
* Validate real\-time integrations between Salesforce and external systems (CTI/Telephony, Jira, ERP) using REST/SOAP API automation with tools like Postman or RestAssured.
* Perform API testing for Salesforce integrations. Conduct performance testing on complex Apex triggers and Flow automations to ensure they handle large data volumes without hitting the governor limit
* Collaborate with developers, admins, and business stakeholders to ensure quality delivery  

Participate in sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives
* Build and maintain scalable, data\-driven automation frameworks (using AccelQ, Selenium, or Provar) specifically designed to handle Salesforce’s dynamic UI and Shadow DOM elements.
* Experience implementing test scripts with XRay is a strong plus
* Perform functional, regression, smoke, and end\-to\-end testing
* Automate regression, smoke, and functional test suites for Service and business processes.
* Maintain automation best practices and optimize execution performance.
* Defect Management: Identify, document, and track bugs in Jira, working closely with Developers and Product Owners to ensure the timely resolution of blockers.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.
* Hands\-on knowledge and understanding of integrating automated regression suites into DevOps pipelines (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, or Jenkins) to support a "Continuous Testing" model

**What we’re looking for:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* 5\+ years of experience in Salesforce Quality Engineering / Automation Testing.
* Prefer at least 5 years focused on functional and regression testing of Go\-to\-Market systems (Salesforce.com) and related integrations.
* Strong hands\-on experience with Service Cloud processes, Objects, Flows, Validation Rules, Apex, and Lightning Experience.
* Experience in testing Case Lifecycle and Customer support business processes.
* Experience with test automation frameworks (Selenium, AccelQ, Provar, or equivalent). Maintain automation best practices and optimize execution performance.
* Proficiency in Java or JavaScript for automation scripting.
* Experience testing APIs (REST/SOAP) using tools like Postman.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.
* Ability to excel in a fast\-paced environment requiring attention to detail, excellent organisational skills, a high degree of motivation, and deadline\-driven productivity.

### **Preferred Certifications**

* Salesforce Certified Administrator
* Salesforce Certified Service Cloud Consultant
* Automation Certificate (Provar/AccelQ)
* ISTQB Foundation or Advanced Level (Test Automation Engineer)

jobs.title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Team Lead, India
jobs.description:
Job Description

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Team Leadership \& Development:**

* Lead, mentor, coach, and develop a team of Talent Coordinators, fostering a high\-performance culture and ensuring continuous professional growth.
* Manage team workload, performance reviews, and daily operations to meet service level agreements and deadlines.
* Drive team engagement and collaboration, ensuring best practices are shared and implemented.

**Process Excellence \& Compliance:**

* Internal Audit \& SOP Adherence: Oversee and ensure strict adherence to all internal HR policies, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and compliance requirements across all talent coordination activities.
* Proactively identify areas for process improvement and implement solutions to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.
* Contribute to the development and refinement of talent coordination SOPs.

**Candidate \& New Hire Experience:**

* Offer Generation \& Management: Supervise the accurate and timely generation, distribution, and tracking of employment offer letters and related documentation.
* New Joiner Induction \& Onboarding: Design, implement, and continuously optimize the new hire induction and comprehensive onboarding experience, ensuring a seamless, welcoming, and informative start for all new employees in a large organizational context.
* Ensure all pre\-onboarding activities are completed efficiently.

**Operations \& Vendor Management:**

* Background Verification: Manage and streamline the end\-to\-end background verification process, ensuring compliance with legal and company standards.
* Vendor Management: Effectively manage relationships with external vendors (e.g., background check providers, onboarding platform vendors) critical to the talent acquisition and onboarding process, ensuring service quality and cost\-effectiveness for a large organization.
* Manage and track all associated documentation and data meticulously.

**Stakeholder Collaboration:**

* Act as a primary point of contact and subject matter expert for talent coordination processes, collaborating closely with Recruiters, HR Business Partners, Hiring Managers, IT, and other internal departments.
* Provide expert guidance on complex coordination queries and issues.

**Reporting \& Analytics:**

* Track, analyze, and report on key talent coordination metrics (e.g., time\-to\-onboard, offer acceptance rates, background check completion times) to identify trends and inform decision\-making.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Minimum of 8\+ years of progressive experience in Talent Acquisition Coordination, HR Operations, or a similar field.
* At least 5\+ years of demonstrated experience in a leadership role, managing and mentoring a team of Talent Coordinators or HR professionals.

**Proven expertise and hands\-on experience in:**

* Leading internal audit processes related to HR/TA operations.
* Developing, implementing, and ensuring adherence to SOPs.
* Designing and executing comprehensive new joiner induction programs.
* Managing the end\-to\-end offer generation process.
* Crafting and delivering exceptional new hire onboarding experiences.
* Overseeing background verification processes.
* Effective vendor management, specifically within large, multi\-national organizations.
* Exceptional organizational skills with a strong ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast\-paced environment.
* Superior communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact professionally with candidates, employees, and senior leadership.
* Advanced proficiency with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and HR Information Systems (HRIS).
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills, with a data\-driven approach to process improvement.
* High level of integrity and ability to handle confidential information with discretion.


Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy

Mondelez India Foods Private Limited (formerly Cadbury India Ltd.) has been in India for over 70 years, making sure our mouth\-watering and well\-loved local and global brands such as *Cadbury* chocolates, *Bournvita* and *Tang* powdered beverages, *Oreo* and *Cadbury Bournvita* biscuits, and *Halls* and *Cadbury Choclairs Gold* candies get safely into our customers hands—and mouths*.* Headquartered in Mumbai, the company has more than 3,300 employees proudly working across sales offices in New Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Chennai and in manufacturing facilities at Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh, at our global Research \& Development Technical Centre and Global Business Hub in Maharashtra and in a vast distribution network across the country. We are also proud to be recognised by Avatar as the Best Companies for Women in India in 2019 – the fourth time we’ve received this award.
