jobs.title: Technical Program Manager II
jobs.description:
**Our Purpose**

*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200\+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*

**Title and Summary**


Technical Program Manager II
Analyst\- Project Management \& Metrics  

Team Overview
  

Implement a Technology Service Assurance function to drive standard, consistent, compliant, transparent, scalable and well\-controlled oversight of Service Level Agreements(SLAs) \& Service Level Objectives(SLOs) across Mastercard Products and Intragroup Company Agreements (ICAs) that align with Mastercard's business operations reality, regulatory obligations and expectations  

  

Job Role  

Oversee governance and control metrics agreed for Mastercard Products \& Technology Services  

  

All about you /Skillsets:  

* Project management skills to ensure on\-time delivery
* Good communication skills for coordinating globally
* Demonstrated capability in developing technical designs and collaborating with the engineering team to ensure successful implementation.
* Ability to design metrics, dashboards, and analyze data, data collation
* Experience in Creation of Domo Dashboards, Power BI, Power apps, Excel Dashboards, MS office would be added advantage
* Any background in drafting and reviewing intercompany agreements is advantageous


Key Responsibilities:  

* Collect and validate data from various sources and ensure readiness for analysis
* Transform data into the right data set before analysis
* Assist in the quantitative analysis of data and generate reports of analysis
* In\-depth understanding of data and data sources in the organization
* Assists senior team members in the development of tools, documents and presentations
* Executing data analysis, customer reporting reviews and other quality assurance procedures
* Execute quantitative analysis of data and generate operations reports
* Collaborate with different teams including Legal, Regulatory, Tech, Finance, Operations, and business teams
* Lead and support service mapping efforts to visualize the flow of services between intragroup service providers and consumers.
* Implement Third party / supplier monitoring and reporting process
* Support in implementation of SLA monitoring and reporting process
* Develop and manage a centralized repositories for evidences (Ex. Confluence, Share point…)
* Track version control, signatories, amendments, and entity specific annexes
* Build and maintain playbooks, templates and guidance materials

**Corporate Security Responsibility**

  

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

jobs.title: Head - Supply Chain (E-Commerce)
jobs.company: Brisk Olive Business Solutions Pvt Ltd
jobs.description:
**Job Summary** 

The Head \- Supply Chain will provide strategic leadership and ownership of the entire supply chain function for our e\-commerce and quick commerce businesses, spanning **Amazon**, **Flipkart**, **Zepto**, **Blinkit**, and other marketplaces.

This senior role is responsible for developing advanced supply strategies, optimizing multi channel inventory, ensuring high service levels and operational excellence, and building and leading a high\-performance team. The Head must ensure **zero stock\-outs (OOS) and no overstock conditions**, drive cost efficiency, and align supply chain activities with broader business goals.

**Key Responsibilities** 

**1Strategic Supply Chain Leadership** 

·

·

Define \& execute the **end\-to\-end supply chain strategy** for all platforms

marketplaces, quick commerce, and D2C channels.

* Lead demand planning, supply planning, and inventory allocation to meet forecasted

demand and promotional spikes.

· Drive multi\-platform replenishment strategies to **avoid stock\-outs and overstock** 

while optimizing working capital.

· Partner with Sales, Marketing, and Commercial teams to align inventory strategy with

promotions, launches, and peak sales events.

**2Borecasting**, **Planning \& Analytics** 

* Lead advanced **demand forecasting models** using historical, seasonal, and

marketplace trend data.

\- Ensure real\-time visibility of stock across warehouses, fulfillment centers, and

marketplace FCs.

* Identify and implement predictive analytics and automation tools for improved

forecast accuracy and replenishment.

Champion dashboards for supply chain insights.

**3Inventory Optimisation \& KPIs** 

·

Maintain optimal inventory levels across marketplaces and fulfillment networks to

**prevent both OOS and excess inventory**.

· Manage inventory KPIs such as Inventory Turns, Fill Rate, Days of Inventory (DOI),

and Stock Accuracy.

* Ensure healthy inventory profiles across all platforms and channels, minimizing

obsolete/aging inventory.

**4Warehousing, Fulfilment \& Distribution** 

* Oversee warehousing strategy, including central DCs, regional hubs, dark stores,

and 3PL partners.

Ensure warehouse accuracy, compliance, and efficient operations to meet service

level requirements.

* Track inbound \& outbound logistics, route optimisation, freight costs, and capacity

utilisation.

* Ensure marketplace FC compliance (FBA/Flipkart FCs) and quick commerce SLA

adherence.

**5Cost \& Unit Economics Optimisation** 

· Drive cost reduction initiatives across inventory holding cost, logistics cost per order,

return cost, and fulfilment cost.

· Lead 3PL and logistics partner negotiations for sustainable cost benefits. Develop

plans for continuous cost control based on periodic unit economics reviews.

**6Team Leadership \& Stakeholder Management** 

·

* Lead, mentor, and grow a high\-impact supply chain team across planning,

operations, logistics, and analytics.

* Build a culture of accountability, performance excellence, and cross\-functional

collaboration.

* Serve as a core strategic partner to senior leadership, presenting performance, risks,

and opportunities.

· Coordinate with Finance for budgeting, cost tracking, and audit compliance.

**7Continuous Improvement** 

* Identify process bottlenecks and lead improvement initiatives using Lean/Six Sigma

principles where applicable.

Plan infrastructure scaling \- — new warehouses, integrated technology, automation

(WMS, OMS, control towers).

* Ensure documentation of SOPs, risk management plans, and business continuity

strategies.

**Reporting \& MIS Governance** 

The Head \- Customer Experience will be responsible for preparing and presenting structured weekly and monthly MIS reports to management for performance review and decision\-making.

·

Reports must include:

· Service partner performance scorecard (city / zone wise)

* Performance of all internal team members (ASM, coordinators, call center)

Performance of external teams (service partners \& outsourced call center) ·

Average call closing / resolution time (TAT)

· Target vs Achieved service KPIs

·

· Total open cases

· Cases closed within SLA, beyond SLA

* Pending cases within SLA, beyond SLA

Escalation and repeat complaint analysis

* Trend analysis and improvement action plan

The candidate must ensure reports are data\-driven, accurate, and actionable, and

present improvement plans during management review meetings.

**Requirements** 

✓ MBA/PGDM in Supply Chain, Operations, Logistics, or related field

*✓* 15\+ years of experience in supply chain and e\-commerce operations (inventory, warehousing, logistics)

✓ 5\+ years in **senior leadership or strategic roles**, leading teams and building scalable processes

✓ Experience with marketplaces (Amazon, Flipkart), quick commerce (Zepto, Blinkit), and multi\-location networks

✓ Strong analytical skills with advanced Excel, Gsuite expertise

✓ Proven track record of reducing costs while increasing service levels

✓ Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills

**Preferred:** Certification in Supply Chain / SCPro / APICS / Lean/Six Sigma, Experience

scaling warehouse infrastructure and automation systems, Proven platform\-wise strategy experience across marketplaces and quick commerce

need a candidate who:

Has handled **end\-to\-end multi\-platform supply chain strategy** (marketplaces \+ quick commerce \+ D2C)

Has strong expertise in **advanced demand forecasting, inventory optimisation**, **and replenishment planning** 

Can ensure **zero OOS and zero overstock** while maintaining healthy inventory turns

Has managed **multi\-location warehouses, 3PLs, dark stores**, **and marketplace FC compliance** 

Has driven **cost optimisation and unit economics improvements** 

Can build and lead a high\-performance team with strong cross\-functional alignment Is capable of presenting structured **weekly \& monthly MIS to management**, including service performance dashboards, SLA analysis, team performance scorecards, TAT reports, target vs achieved metrics, open/closed case analysis, and improvement action plans

Job Type: Permanent

Pay: ₹800,000\.00 \- ₹900,000\.00 per year

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Divisional Risk and Control Senior Analyst, AVP
jobs.description:
**Job Description:**
--------------------

**Job Title: Divisional Risk and Control Senior Analyst, AVP**

**Location: Mumbai, India**

**Role Description**

* The Market Conduct Office (MCO) is responsible for embedding market conduct in business decisions, and improving the efficiency, sustainability and transparency of market conduct controls. Residing within the Front Office and reporting up into the Head of the IB, MCO will focus on providing governance and oversight for all of DB activities related to market conduct.
* MCO will promote resiliency and sustainability of the Market Conduct control environment and mitigate risks by overseeing and supporting the firm’s risk management, internal controls, governance, and culture relating to market conduct to foster trust and confidence in DB’s provision of financial services.

**What we’ll offer you**

As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you’ll enjoy


* Best in class leave policy
* Gender neutral parental leaves
* 100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
* Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
* Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
* Accident and Term life Insurance
* Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above

**Your Key Responsibilities**

The MI, Reporting, \& Governance role will focus on translating multiple sources of market conduct information into tangible actions to ensure a strong controls culture are embedded into our Bank. The successful candidate will:


* Partner with first and second line teams to establish appropriate governance and conduct risk management frameworks
* Coordinate the preparation of meeting packs for senior market conduct governance forums
* Supporting ongoing regulatory reporting and monitoring with market conduct nexus
* Support the business by communicating market conduct requirements and providing actionable guidance to ensure compliance with relevant laws, rules and regulations.
* Support the design of market conduct controls and monitor control effectiveness.
* Ensure complete and timely resolution of market conduct issues, exceptions, and findings.

**Your skills and experience**

* Knowledge and understanding of financial markets/products.
* Familiarity with governance, risk management, and conduct frameworks.
* Excellent communication, both written and oral, and the ability to convey complex concepts simply and foster transparency across teams and levels.
* Strong stakeholder engagement and relationship management skills, including the ability to collaborate, create buy\-in, and manage expectations.
* Strong presentation and facilitation skills for synthesizing inputs from diverse sources.
* Proven organizational, analytical, and problem\-solving skills, aligned with excellent attention to detail and time management.

**How we’ll support you**

* Training and development to help you excel in your career
* Coaching and support from experts in your team
* A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
* A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

**About us and our teams**

Please visit our company website for further information:
 

https://www.db.com/company/company.html


We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.


Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.


We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

jobs.title: Senior Salesforce Automation Quality Engineer – Sales Cloud
jobs.description:
**Job Ad**
==========


We are seeking a **Senior Salesforce Automation Quality Engineer – Sales Cloud** with strong expertise in Salesforce Sales Cloud testing and automation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing robust automation frameworks to ensure high\-quality **Salesforce Sales Cloud** and **CPQ** implementations.


Salesforce is critical to the success of our Sales, Customer Support, and Marketing teams, and you’ll play a key role in managing the quality of this system.


As a **Senior** **Salesforce Automation Quality Engineer/SDET**, you’ll partner with Salesforce Developers, Administrators, and Revenue Operations Analysts to ensure the highest quality of our Go\-to\-Market systems. Successful candidates have experience administering Salesforce.com and have eagle\-eye attention to detail, and experience with ensuring Salesforce.com configuration and customizations are implemented correctly.


 We work with strict deadlines, so strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and exceptional time management and task execution skills are key.

**This position will report to the Senior Manager GTM Systems and will be based in our Pune, India, Procore office. We’re looking for candidates to join us immediately.**

**What you’ll do:**

* Design, develop, and execute **automated and manual test cases** for Salesforce Sales Cloud applications. Perform functional, regression, smoke, and end\-to\-end testing
* Validate Salesforce configurations, including **flows, validation rules, security settings, OWD, profiles, roles, reports, dashboards, LWC, and Apex.**  

Test core Sales Cloud features such as **Leads, Accounts, Contacts, Opportunities Management, Campaigns, Territory Management, and Forecasting.**
* Develop and maintain Salesforce automation frameworks. Execute and maintain automation scripts and integrate them with CI/CD pipelines
* Perform API testing for Salesforce integrations. Conduct performance testing on complex Apex triggers and Flow automations to ensure they handle large data volumes without hitting the governor limit
* Collaborate with developers, admins, and business stakeholders to ensure quality delivery
* Participate in sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives
* Ensure data integrity across Account, Opportunity, Contact, and other objects.
* Build and maintain scalable, data\-driven automation frameworks (using **AccelQ**, Selenium, or Provar) specifically designed to handle Salesforce’s dynamic UI and Shadow DOM elements.
* Experience implementing test scripts with **XRay** is a strong plus
* Automate regression, smoke, and functional test suites for Sales and business processes..
* Maintain automation best practices and optimize execution performance.
* Defect Management: Identify, document, and track bugs in Jira, working closely with Developers and Product Owners to ensure the timely resolution of blockers.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.
* Ability to excel in a fast\-paced environment requiring attention to detail, excellent organisational skills, a high degree of motivation, and deadline\-driven productivity.

**What we’re looking for:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* 5\+ years of experience in **Salesforce Quality Engineering** / **Automation Testing**. Prefer at least 5 years focused on functional and regression testing of Go\-to\-Market systems (Salesforce.com) and related integrations.
* Strong hands\-on experience with **Sales Cloud** processes, Objects, Flows, Validation Rules, Apex, and Lightning Experience.
* Experience in testing Sales Lifecycle and CRM business processes.
* Experience with test automation frameworks (Selenium, **AccelQ**, Provar, or equivalent). Maintain automation best practices and optimize execution performance.
* Proficiency in Java or JavaScript for automation scripting.
* Experience testing APIs (REST/SOAP) using tools like Postman.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.
* Ability to excel in a fast\-paced environment requiring attention to detail, excellent organisational skills, a high degree of motivation, and deadline\-driven productivity.

**Preferred Certifications**

* Salesforce Certified Administrator
* Salesforce Certified Sales Cloud Consultant
* ISTQB Foundation or Advanced Level (Test Automation Engineer)

jobs.title: Integrity Lead
jobs.description:
**Job Requirements**  

**Title: Sr. Integrity Engineer**

**Roles \& Responsibilities**:

* This position is a mechanical integrity technical position for fixed equipment in support of petrochemical facility
* This position provides technical support to the client with a focus on managing the risk based inspection program, troubleshooting, asset improvement, and technology selection
* Provide strong technical leadership in Inspection/Corrosion Management for Oil \& Gas upstream/downstream assets
* Provide technical solution in upstream/downstream Asset Integrity
* Has ability to create innovative solutions /automations/ methodologies to build a differentiation for Quest Global
* Integrity assessment/assurance activities like FFS, Corrosion Evaluations and Remaining Life Studies
* Drive and manage Integrity Engineers to execute the workflows with Quality at scale
* Provide pre\-sales support for new business deals and post\-sales support for the new projects assigned
* Drive core team members to recruit skilled resources or train internal resources to achieve the targets
* Act as a bridge between customer, sales organization and global technical teams
* Lead Develop, nurture and manage global customer relationships and drive strategic partnering initiatives to address unique business situations and complex technology needs
* Review technical scoping, estimation, fitment and feasibility studies, mapping customer expectations and solution design, prepared by Program Managers and Project Leader
* Degradation evaluations related to pressure equipment, heat exchangers, piping circuits, fired equipment, flares, above ground storage tanks, and/or pressure relief devices.
* Monitoring and surveillance of integrity parameters to ensure reliable operations.
* Troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and integrity recommendation stewardship.
* Bad actor identification and analysis to reduce equipment downtime.
* Data analytics, digital tools/ technologies and operationalize upgraded work practices through digital transformation.
* Overall integrity effectiveness and management which includes, criticality assessments, consequence/ complexity rating of fixed equipment, development of fit\-for\-purpose risk based strategies, setting optimum task intervals including considerations to local regulations/ statutory requirements, timely review of inspection findings, and ever\-greening of strategies.
* Regional oversight and stewardship of integrity work product metrics for quality, effectiveness, and efficiency in achieving business unit/ manufacturing site objectives.
* Coordination and communication between various global centers and business affiliates for various aspects like, knowledge transfer, sharing learnings, skill management and maintaining business relationships.
* Technical mentoring and continuous on\-the\-job guidance to new members in the team.
* Ability to learn and adapt to an agile and flexible working environment, continuously stay abreast of latest developments in industry standards/ practices, bring in leanings/ experience to challenge and improvise company work processes/ practices.
* Analysis of inspection results and recommended future actions
* Perform mechanical analysis of required thickness and fitness for service assessments

  

**Work Experience**  

**Required Qualifications \& Competencies:**

* Engineering degree (Mechanical/Materials or Chemical) 4 to 6\+ years of oil gas experience in related industry (refining/petrochemical/LNG/oil \& gas)
* Should have sound knowledge on Oil \& Gas upstream and downstream business in the following areas
* Risk Based Inspection methodologies
* Fixed equipment inspection tasks/ procedures
* Inspection Optimization
* Piping Circutization/TML development
* API Damage Mechanisms of Refinery/Chemicals
* In\-service inspection of all types of fixed equipment
* Knowledge of materials and standards
* Knowledge of corrosion \& welding
* Knowledge of NDTs
* Thickness inspection management and analysis
* Corrosion management and analysis
* Inspection plan development/ optimization.
* Knowledge of software (APM Meridium/Pestra/Casmeredo, etc.)
* Ability to lead teams
* Excellent communication
* Should have working knowledge of oil and gas plant operations
* Should have exposure to Operating condition Safety, SHE risks, spill/ safety incident and equipment failure opportunities
* Should have Knowledge of various roles and responsibilities of engineers working in the oil and gas field/site
* Should have knowledge of corrective and preventative maintenance strategy
* Should have knowledge of International standards in design, quality, and procedures for approved equipment
* Working knowledge in key sections of ASME Sec Div. 1/2, ASME Sec V, ASME Sec IX, ASME Sec Il, ASME B31\.3/ B31\.1/ B31\.4/ B31\.8, ASME PCC\-2
* Field in\-service inspection and repair of pressure equipment, heat exchangers, piping systems, pressure relief devices and above ground storage tanks in operating unit
* Experience with Office applications (Word, Excel, and Power Point)
* Strong verbal/ written communication skills in English
* Good interpersonal skills, adaptability and working collaboratively with the other teams
* Willing to work in shift timings with flexibility to meet business needs
* Flexible to work in different locations depending on business requirement
* Flexibility to travel internationally as per business needs

 **Good to have skills:**

* Certification and in\-depth working knowledge in API 580, API 510, API 570, API 571 , API 653, NACE Senior Corrosion Technologist, BSI ISO/ ENI AS Standards, AWS/ CSWIP/ ASNT NDT Techniques
* Experience with Meridium/Credo/Pestra and SAP
* Implementation of Automation, AI, IOT techniques in Oil \& Gas Portfolio

jobs.title: HCM Business Advisory Analyst, AS
jobs.description:
**Job Description:**
--------------------

**Job Title:** **HCM Business Advisory Analyst**

**Location:** **Bangalore, India**

**Corporate Title: AS**

**Role Description**

HCM Business Advisory supports HR strategies and initiatives across the bank. It is also a key enabler of effective delivery of the banks HR strategy through the provision of expert knowledge and support on HR policies, programmes, processes, people strategy and ensures consistent application of HR best practice.


On an advisory level work typically includes:


* Responsibility for the delivery of HR Services.
* Working with stakeholders in implementing people agenda initiatives, providing advice to employees and managers on people topics, providing guidance on HR policies and processes (incl. ensuring compliance) and overall responsibility for lifecycle measures.
* Working with the business and specialist HR product areas to achieve bank\-wide human capital management goals. Examples may include but are not limited to; restructuring, diversity and talent acquisition and retention initiatives, supporting performance management activity, leadership capabilities, management of employee relations cases and consequence management and key partner in the year\-end compensation and promotion process.

On a business partnering level work typically includes:


* Responsibility and accountability for delivering the HR people strategy in support of the overall business strategy.
* Coaching senior managers in global/regional or divisional teams in modelling required leadership behaviors and conforming to the bank’s standard policies and processes.
* Partnering with the heads of business to ensure sound people decisions are undertaken.
* Supporting and driving organizational change and restructuring initiatives and work with respective stakeholders
* Partnering with the business to define and translate business needs into human capital strategy.
* Driving the global processes, also in region, country or sub\-division, e.g. year\-end compensation and promotion process and talent management, ensuring fair and consistent decisions are made with appropriate business management governance and ownership.

**What we’ll offer you**

As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you’ll enjoy


* Best in class leave policy
* Gender neutral parental leaves
* 100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
* Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
* Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
* Accident and Term life Insurance
* Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above

**Your key responsibilities**

* Handling employee, former employees, HR Advisor, Internal HR solutions team queries on HR products via email and telephone for employees across APAC locations/UKUS
* Good knowledge of Applications like Workday, Service Now, Oracle PeopleSoft
* Thorough knowledge of policy queries like PF, UAN \& Flexi basket.
* Responsible for providing resolution to all first level queries.
* Queries handled should to meet 100% quality.
* Work to established standards on SLA \& accuracy standards to ensure completion of transactions, escalation to appropriate teams as necessary and follow\-ups to close pending issues.
* Should have the right attitude towards customer handling.
* Should be logged in to the Genesys Phone lines and be available for 8 hrs. Considering 1 hr break in the 9hrs login.

**Your skills and experience**

* Experience in query handling transaction processing preferably in a shared services environment.
* Exposure to domain areas of HR like Onboarding, Background Screening, Offboarding, Benefits and Data Management, Payroll etc.
* Good email and telephone etiquettes.
* Will to work in shifts (APAC US \& UK).
* Good client management and influencing skills.
* Customer and service orientation with strong focus on process orientation.
* Ability to follow process specifications across multiple types of transactions/ queries.
* Sensitivity to accuracy, timeliness and completeness of transactions/queries.
* Ability to sustain accuracy over repetitive transactions/ queries.
* Strong follow\-through and ownership over closure of issues.
* Sensitivity to SLA driven approach, accountability\-based work ethic.
* Typing skills \& good excel skills to be able to do reporting and data analysis.
* Familiar with the Oracle people soft tool, Service Now, Workday
* Ability to take ownership and initiative for process improvement.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, required to converse with clients from various locations and cultures across the APAC/UK/US regions

**How we’ll support you**

* Training and development to help you excel in your career
* Coaching and support from experts in your team
* A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
* A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

**About us and our teams**

Please visit our company website for further information:


**https://www.db.com/company/company.html**

We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.


Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.


We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

jobs.title: Manager / Senior Manager – Administration
jobs.description:
**Manager / Senior Manager – Administration**

**Let's talk spine \- because most of India doesn't.**

Founded when surgery was the only mainstream solution to back pain, QI Spine emerged with a simple idea: **non\-surgical recovery should be the first option, not the last resort.** Since then, we've built India's only spine\-focused medical system \- combining the expertise of **250\+ specialists** with cutting\-edge AI tools like Doctor QI, our proprietary diagnostic engine. With **22 clinics** across major cities, we've:

\- Consulted over **2\.5 lakh patients**

\- Prevented **15,000\+ unnecessary spine surgeries**

\- Achieved a **93% recovery rate** \- among the best in the world

**Our mission?**

To redefine spine care by blending clinical excellence, intelligent systems, and strong operational discipline.

**About the Role:**

Manager / Senior Manager \- Administration is effectively leading the administration function for the organization across India. This individual will be responsible for defining, implementing, and overseeing all administrative policies, procedures, and services to ensure the efficient, safe, and cost\-effective operation of all regional offices and clinics. Leading a regional team of Admin Executives, the Senior Manager will drive best practices, optimize resource utilization, and contribute significantly to the overall organizational efficiency and employee well\- being.

**What You'll Own:**

**Functional Leadership:**

* Develop and implement a comprehensive administrative strategy aligned with the organization's overall business objectives and growth plans across all regional offices and clinics.
* Act as the functional lead for administration, providing strategic direction, guidance, and expertise to the leadership team.
* Establish and maintain high standards for administrative services, ensuring consistency and quality across all locations.
* Forecast administrative needs and proactively plan for future requirements, including infrastructure, resources, and technology.

**Team Leadership \& Management:**

* Lead, mentor, and develop a high\-performing regional team of Admin Executives and support staff.
* Set clear performance objectives, conduct regular performance reviews, and provide constructive feedback to team members.
* Foster a collaborative and supportive team environment, promoting skill development and career growth.
* Ensure optimal staffing levels and efficient deployment of the admin team across regions.

**Facilities Management \& Infrastructure:**

* Oversee all aspects of facilities management for regional offices and clinics, including space planning, office layout, maintenance, and repairs.
* Manage office fit\-outs, renovations, and relocations from inception to completion.
* Ensure all facilities comply with health, safety, and environmental regulations and organizational standards.
* Implement robust preventative maintenance programs for all equipment and infrastructure.

**Vendor Management \& Procurement:**

* Identify, evaluate, and manage a network of vendors for various administrative services (e.g., security, housekeeping, travel, stationery, IT hardware support, AMC services).
* Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing to achieve cost efficiencies and favorable agreements.
* Monitor vendor performance and ensure adherence to service level agreements (SLAs).
* Oversee the procurement process for administrative supplies and equipment, ensuring quality and cost\-effectiveness.

**Security \& Safety Management:**

* Develop and implement comprehensive security protocols and emergency response plans for all offices and clinics.
* Ensure the safety and well\-being of employees, visitors, and assets across all locations.
* Conduct regular security audits and drills, and implement necessary improvements.
* Liaise with local authorities and law enforcement as required.

**Budgeting \& Cost Control:**

* Prepare and manage the annual administrative budget for all regional offices and clinics.
* Monitor expenses, analyze variances, and implement cost\-saving measures without compromising service quality.
* Ensure efficient utilization of resources and optimal return on administrative investments.

**Travel \& Logistics:**

* Oversee corporate travel arrangements, including policy development, vendor management, and support for employees.
* Manage logistics for inter\-office movements, events, and other organizational activities.

**Compliance \& Documentation:**

* Ensure all administrative operations comply with relevant legal, regulatory, and organizational policies.
* Maintain accurate records, documentation, and reports related to administrative functions.
* Develop and update administrative policies and procedures manuals.

**Stakeholder Management:**

* Collaborate effectively with cross\-functional teams, including HR, Finance, IT, Operations, and Clinical teams, to ensure seamless administrative support.
* Act as a key point of contact for administrative matters for regional heads and clinic managers.

**What We're Looking For:**

* Minimum of 8\-10 years of progressive experience in Administration and Facilities Management, with at least 5 years in a leadership role overseeing multi\-location operations.
* Proven experience in heading the administration function for an organization with a distributed presence (regional offices and/or clinics) across India.
* Demonstrated ability to lead, mentor, and develop a team of administrative professionals.
* Strong understanding of facilities management best practices, safety regulations, and procurement processes.
* Excellent negotiation, vendor management, and contract administration skills.
* Proficient in budget management and cost control.
* Exceptional communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast\-paced environment.
* Strong problem\-solving and decision\-making abilities.
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and experience with administrative software/tools.
* Willingness / Flexibity to travel extensively across India.
* Strong problem\-solving abilities and a continuous improvement mindset.

**What You'll Get:**

* A mission\-critical role with direct impact on strategic decision\-making and QI Spine's ambitious 10X growth journey.
* The unparalleled opportunity to significantly build and innovate the entire data and analytics function of a rapidly scaling organization.
* High ownership, direct accountability for key strategic areas, and exceptional visibility within the leadership team.
* A challenging yet immensely rewarding environment where your expertise directly translates into tangible improvements in business performance and patient outcomes.
* A workplace where your contributions aren't just possible—they're expected—and where you can truly be a "**QIpreneur**," shaping the future of healthcare from the ground up.

**Let's build better spine care www.qispine.com**

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹1,000,000\.00 \- ₹1,500,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Application Question(s):

* What is your current total compensation (CTC) in LPA (Lakhs Per Annum)?
* What is your expected total compensation (CTC) in LPA (Lakhs Per Annum)?
* What is your notice period? (Please specify in days)
* This role involves a six\-day work week. Please confirm if you’re comfortable with this.
* Will you be able to reliably commute or relocate to Kurla West, Mumbai, Maharashtra for this job?
* How many locations/facilities have you directly managed at the same time?
* What was the size of your team?
* Have you managed CAPEX and OPEX budgets?
* Have you independently executed facility projects (office setup, relocation, renovation, expansion)?
* Have you handled safety audits (fire, electrical, building safety)?
* Have you used a ticketing/helpdesk system for maintenance tracking?
* Have you independently negotiated vendor contracts?

Language:

* English (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Required)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Director, Customer Support
jobs.description:
At NiCE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Always. We’re ambitious. We’re game changers. And we play to win. We set the highest standards and execute beyond them. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the ultimate career opportunity that will light a fire within you.

**So, what’s the role all about?**



We are seeking a strategic, experienced, and customer\-obsessed **Director of Customer** Support to lead and scale our global support operations for our Enterprise SaaS platform to the Financial Services industry. The group includes functions as Cloud Support, On Premise Support and Managed Services. This role involves managing a global support team, ensuring high\-quality service delivery, and working closely with engineering, sales, and product teams to provide timely solutions to customers. The director will also drive operational improvements, set strategic goals, and ensure that the support team meets all service level agreements (SLAs) while maintaining a focus on customer satisfaction and business growth.


**What you will be doing?**


**Leadership \& Team Management**


* Define and execute the global customer support strategy aligned with business goals, customer success metrics, and operational efficiency.
* Lead and manage the customer support team across multiple regions, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer needs
* Build, lead, mentor, and scale a geographically distributed support team (Tier 1–3\) off over 100 staff. Establish clear goals, performance metrics, and career development plans.
* Promote a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement within the team


**Strategic Direction \& Planning**


* Develop and implement strategic plans to improve cloud support operations, ensuring scalability and efficiency as the business grows
* Collaborate with senior leadership to align cloud support objectives with overall company strategy
* Manage the performance and effectiveness of the cloud support team, tracking KPIs and ensuring that customer expectations are met or exceeded


**Customer Support Excellence**


* Act as the voice of the customer internally. Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to ensure issues are addressed and feedback is looped into product development.
* Oversee the resolution of customer support cases, ensuring timely and effective solutions
* Ensure the team is proactive in identifying and addressing potential issues before they impact customers
* Act as the escalation point for complex or critical customer issues, working with internal teams to resolve them quickly
* Monitor and analyze CSAT/NPS (Customer Satisfaction/Net Promoter Score) and other feedback metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement


**Operational Efficiency**


* Drive operational efficiency by implementing best practices, tools, automation and processes to streamline support operations and track progress
* Establish clear SLAs and performance metrics, ensuring that the cloud support team meets or exceeds them
* Implement and oversee the use of monitoring tools and reporting systems to track cloud service health and performance
* Ensure smooth integration and collaboration between cloud support and other departments (e.g., R\&D, Sales, Customer Success)


**Collaboration with Cross\-functional Teams**


* Work closely with product management, engineering, and sales teams to ensure customer needs are understood and supported
* Provide input into the development of new cloud products and services to ensure supportability and customer satisfaction
* Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to improve cloud solutions based on customer feedback and support trends


**Cloud Infrastructure \& Tools Management**


* Oversee the tools and technologies used for cloud support, ensuring they are efficient, automated and scalable
* Ensure the team is fully trained and equipped with the tools necessary for effective cloud support
* Evaluate and recommend new cloud technologies or processes to improve support delivery


**Budget \& Resource Management**


* Manage the customer support department’s budget, ensuring proper allocation of resources to meet business needs
* Forecast resource requirements and allocate resources effectively to handle customer demand
* Ensure cost\-effective operations while maintaining high\-quality service


**Compliance \& Security**


* Ensure that cloud support operations comply with relevant legal, regulatory, and security standards
* Work with security teams to address any security\-related customer concerns or incidents within cloud environments
* Develop and enforce best practices for data protection and privacy


**Reporting \& Communication**


* Provide regular reports to executive leadership on cloud support performance, including backlog, MTTR, problem areas, customer satisfaction, escalations, resource utilization, and cost
* Monitor, report, and drive improvements across support metrics (CSAT, NPS, FRT, TTR, resolution rate). Use data to continuously improve the customer experience.
* Ensure clear and effective communication within the support team and with other internal stakeholders


**Continuous Improvement**


* Drive initiatives to continuously improve the cloud support process and the overall customer experience
* Prepare support systems for continued global growth, product expansion, and increased customer complexity.
* Lead post\-mortem and root cause analysis after major incidents or service disruptions, implementing corrective actions


**Have you got what it takes?**


* Proven leadership experience (typically 10\+ years) in cloud support or related fields, with a strong background in managing cloud\-based infrastructure and teams.
* Leadership experience in building and managing high\-performance teams.
* Strong understanding of cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP) and how they relate to customer support needs.
* Ability to collaborate with cross\-functional teams including product, engineering, and sales.
* Excellent communication and problem\-solving skills.
* Customer\-focused mindset with a deep understanding of CSAT and NPS metrics.
* Ability to manage budgets and resources effectively.
* Experience in working with global teams and cross\-cultural environments.
* This role requires a strong balance of strategic leadership, operational efficiency, and customer\-centric focus.


**What’s in it for you?**



Join an ever\-growing, market disrupting, global company where the teams – comprised of the best of the best – work in a fast\-paced, collaborative, and creative environment! As the market leader, every day at NICE is a chance to learn and grow, and there are endless internal career opportunities across multiple roles, disciplines, domains, and locations. If you are passionate, innovative, and excited to constantly raise the bar, you may just be our next NICEr!


**Enjoy NICE\-FLEX!**



At NICE, we work according to the NICE\-FLEX hybrid model, which enables maximum flexibility: 2 days working from the office and 3 days of remote work, each week. Naturally, office days focus on face\-to\-face meetings, where teamwork and collaborative thinking generate innovation, new ideas, and a vibrant, interactive atmosphere.


**Requisition ID:** 10016  

**Reporting into:** Senior Director  

**Role Type:** Director

 ***About NiCE***

*NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000\+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NiCE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3\+ billion financial transactions.*

*Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NiCE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30\+ countries.*

*NiCE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.*

jobs.title: Sr. Artist Manager AndBusiness Development
jobs.description:
**Role \& Responsibilities:\***

\* Supervise the entire business ecosystem for assigned artists, ensuring long\-term commercial sustainability and brand equity.

\* Plan and strategize the long\-term career trajectory and artistic growth of the talent roster.

\* Lead the vision for new talent acquisition, supervising the scouting team responsible for identifying fresh faces.

\* Oversee the strategic management of the artist's public profile, ensuring alignment with their career goals.

\* Personally lead the charge in generating revenue by securing high\-value live shows, brand endorsement deals, webseries/tele show appearances, and music video projects.

\* Establish, maintain, and leverage C\-level connections with Production Houses, Casting Directors, Brand Marketing Heads, and major event companies. Delegate the maintenance of these contacts to the team while you focus on the key decision\-makers.

\* Personally manage relationships with "A\-Listers" and key media gatekeepers, delegating the execution of editorial.

\* Supervise the team to ensure seamless liaison between clients and artists, stepping in only for high\-level conflict resolution or relationship management.

\* Take ultimate ownership of the artist's financial health. Ensure that every month, sufficient funds are available to cover all monthly expenses, salaries, and overheads by overseeing budgeting and forecasting.

\* Oversee the invoices for events and tallying payments received.

\* Coordinating with event companies and direct clients on Payments, GST, and TDS.

\* Managing payouts for all shows, third\-party music teams, and technicians.

\* Supervising of accounting records for all shows.

\* Coordinate directly with the Chartered Accountant (CA) on high\-level financial detailing, tax structuring, and audit requirements.

\* Supervise the legal documents Like Proofreading, drafting, modifying, and altering final agreements. Standing firm on critical clauses during high\-level negotiations. Speaking directly with clients and lawyers.

\* Oversee and conduct all major deal negotiations and coordinate the legal/financial aspects to ensure seamless, profitable closure.

\* Oversee the activities of a dedicated support team (Junior Managers/Coordinators) who handle the daily personal management, logistics (ticketing, hotel booking, transportation), and backend operations for the artists.

\* Supervise the Digital and Social Media Marketing strategy, ensuring the creative output aligns with the artist's brand identity.

\* Supervise the creative work to approve artist creatives, show reels, and marketing collateral, ensuring they meet the strategic vision.

\* Oversee the team's in promoting artists through social media, emailers, and broadcast messages to industry groups.

\***Required Skills \& Qualifications**

\* 15\-20 years of experience in Artist Management, Talent Management, or a related role within the Music, Film, or Entertainment industry.

\* Must have a proven track record and existing relationships with Production Houses, Casting Directors, Event Management companies, and Brand Marketing teams.

\* Exceptional negotiation and deal\-closing abilities.

\* Strong understanding of contract law, financial management, and payment cycles.

\* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

\* Self\-starter, aggressive networker, strategic thinker, discreet, and passionate about artist development.

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹100,000\.00 \- ₹150,000\.00 per month

Benefits:

* Food provided
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: COUNTRY SALES HEAD
jobs.description:
**COUNTRY SALES HEAD**  
**Location:** Bangalore  
**Industry:** Hospitality \| OS\&E \& FF\&E  
**Department:** Sales \& Business Development  
**Employment Type:** Full\-Time

**ABOUT THE COMPANY**  
The company specializes in supplying premium OS\&E and FF\&E to leading 4\-star and 5\-star hospitality projects across India. With a strong focus on quality, design alignment, and execution excellence, the organization partners with hotel owners, developers, consultants, and project teams to deliver large\-scale hospitality projects.

**ROLE OBJECTIVE**  
To lead and scale national sales operations within the hospitality OS\&E and FF\&E segment. The role is responsible for driving revenue growth, expanding the client base, building strategic partnerships, and strengthening market presence across India.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Sales Strategy and Revenue Growth**

* Develop and execute national sales strategy aligned with business objectives
* Drive revenue growth across new hotel developments, renovations, and brand conversions
* Own monthly, quarterly, and annual national sales targets
* Ensure profitability and margin discipline across projects

**Key Account and Strategic Relationship Management**

* Build long\-term relationships with hotel owners, developers, consultants, architects, and project managers
* Lead negotiations for large\-scale OS\&E and FF\&E contracts
* Ensure repeat business and strong client retention
* Represent the company in high\-level commercial discussions

**Team Leadership and Performance Management**

* Build, lead, and manage regional and city\-level sales teams
* Define KPIs and performance benchmarks
* Conduct regular performance reviews and develop high\-performing sales talent
* Foster a performance\-driven and accountable sales culture

**Market Expansion and Brand Positioning**

* Identify new geographic markets and hospitality projects across India
* Strengthen positioning within the premium hospitality segment
* Track competitor activity, pricing trends, and industry shifts
* Identify opportunities in luxury and upscale segments

**Forecasting, Reporting, and Cross\-Functional Coordination**

* Prepare sales forecasts, budgets, and MIS reports
* Maintain CRM discipline and pipeline accuracy
* Collaborate with procurement, design, operations, and finance for seamless execution
* Align sales commitments with operational feasibility

**KEY SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES**

* Strong leadership and team\-building capability
* Proven track record in hospitality project sales, preferably OS\&E or FF\&E
* Advanced negotiation and stakeholder management skills
* Strong commercial understanding of hotel development cycles
* Strategic thinking with execution discipline
* Data\-driven decision\-making approach

**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Hospitality Management, or related field
* MBA or PGDM in Sales or Marketing preferred
* 8 to 10\+ years of experience in hospitality or project\-based sales
* Minimum 3\+ years in senior or national sales leadership role
* Experience working with luxury hotels, developers, or OS\&E / FF\&E suppliers preferred

**KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS**

* National revenue and profitability growth
* Conversion rate of hospitality projects and strategic accounts
* Sales team productivity and target achievement
* Market penetration in premium hotel segments

**SALARY**

* Up to ₹1,00,000 per month

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: From ₹100,000\.00 per month

Benefits:

* Paid sick time
* Provident Fund

Ability to commute/relocate:

* VV Puram, Karnataka: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

* hospitality or project\-based sales: 8 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Head
jobs.description:
**Date:** Feb 16, 2026


**Location:** Kandivali, India


**Company:** ACG


* **Job Objective**



The Head – Marketing will be responsible for building and leading a world\-class global marketing function that strengthens the organization’s position as a trusted, innovative, and preferred capsule partner for pharmaceutical and nutraceutical customers worldwide.  



The role will drive brand leadership, demand generation, customer engagement, and value\-based product positioning, translating market insights into sustained growth and long\-term differentiation.  


* **Primary responsibilities**



1\. **Global Marketing Strategy \& Brand Leadership**


* Develop and execute the global marketing strategy aligned with business growth, portfolio expansion, and geographic priorities.
* Strengthen the organization’s global brand positioning as a quality\-driven, innovation\-led, and reliable capsule manufacturer.
* Ensure consistent brand messaging across regions, markets, and customer touchpoints.

  


**2\. Market Intelligence \& Customer Insights**
* Build deep understanding of customer segments, market trends, therapeutic areas, and formulation needs.
* Lead market intelligence, competitive analysis, and voice\-of\-customer programs.
* Translate insights into clear value propositions, differentiation strategies, and portfolio positioning.

  


**3\. Product \& Portfolio Marketing**
* Own product marketing for capsule technologies across pharma, nutraceutical, and specialty applications.
* Partner with R\&D, Quality, and Regulatory to articulate technical advantages, compliance credentials, and innovation benefits.
* Drive new product launches, lifecycle management, and portfolio rationalization.

  


**4\. Demand Generation \& Commercial Enablement**
* Design and execute global demand\-generation programs to support sales growth across regions.
* Equip Sales teams with strong marketing tools—value decks, technical collaterals, case studies, application notes, and customer success stories.
* Enable value\-based selling through differentiated messaging and evidence\-based narratives.

  


**5\. Digital Marketing \& Marketing Technology**
* Lead digital marketing strategy, including websites, content marketing, campaigns, automation, and analytics.
* Leverage marketing technology (CRM integration, marketing automation, analytics) to improve reach, engagement, and ROI.
* Use data and insights to continuously optimize campaigns and messaging.

  


**6\. Global Campaigns, Events \& Thought Leadership**
* Drive global campaigns, industry events, exhibitions, and technical forums.

* Ensure marketing initiatives are commercially relevant, technically accurate, and operationally feasible.

**8\. Team Leadership \& Capability Building**

* Develop capabilities in **product marketing, digital marketing, content, and analytics**.

**9\. Sustainability \& Corporate Reputation**

* Strengthen **corporate reputation, employer brand, and stakeholder confidence** globally.

  


*Any other additional responsibility could be assigned to the role holder from time to time as a standalone project or regular work. The same would be suitably represented in the Primary responsibilities and agreed between the incumbent, reporting officer and HR.*  


* **Key Result Areas**

jobs.title: AR Finance Business Partner, AWS Global Accounts Receivable Team
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


The AWS Accounts Receivable (AR) team is seeking a self\-driven Finance Leader with a good owner’s mindset, relentless customer advocacy, and frontline obsession to be the global accounts receivables leader for the AWS Public Sector (PS) channel, and other global projects, such as AWS hyperaged small balance. The successful candidate will help us to build the accompanying processes and mechanisms to support this growth and improve free cash flow globally. This will require working across teams that span multiple geographies to drive policy, process, internal and partner facing tools, building and guiding frontline collections, and cash application teams.
  

A critical factor for this position’s success is the ability to manage deep levels of complexity to identify gaps and opportunities, with a proven ability to recommend and implement automation and scalable solutions to streamline workflows. This is a great opportunity to work with Amazon tech teams, learn, and be exposed to cutting edge AI solutions.  

You must be great at communicating complex issues simply and to any audience. You will devise clear strategy, positioning and execution priorities and will be comfortable thinking big and diving deep. This leader will be a pragmatic visionary who can identify opportunities and lead the team to translate them into workable, scalable technology solutions, and must be comfortable partnering and influencing business leaders, customers, technology, and operations stakeholders.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

The O2C WWPS Single Threaded Leader (STL) role is an individual contributor that will count with execution support from a dotted line organization, including Service Centers, Business and Tech teams. The STL must be strategic and detail oriented, have good accounting and finance skills, robust interpersonal and influencing skills (this role will have frequent communication with senior leadership), good organizational and project management skills, and the ability to gather business and technical requirements across global teams to drive systems and change management processes. The STL will need to roll up his/her sleeves, work independently, and have a high level of ownership and accountability.


**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 6\+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
* 6\+ years of identifying and implementing opportunities to resolve finance issues, improve, scale, or simplify finance tools, technology, and processes across teams and organizations experience
* Experience in finance operations, with preference to Order\-to\-Cash (O2C) experience; Program and project management experience; Advanced Excel skills, comfortable handling and analyzing data.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience working with large\-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)
* Experience communicating results to senior leadership
* Experience in Accounts Receivable within large organizations, including Public Sector portfolio.

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.title: Lead Consultant – Contract Compliance & Operationalization Analyst
jobs.description:
Ready to build the future with AI?  

At Genpact, we don’t just keep up with technology—we set the pace. AI and digital innovation are redefining industries, and we’re leading the charge. Genpact’s AI Gigafactory, our industry\-first accelerator, is an example of how we’re scaling advanced technology solutions to help global enterprises work smarter, grow faster, and transform at scale. From large\-scale models to agentic AI, our breakthrough solutions tackle companies’ most complex challenges.  

If you thrive in a fast\-moving, innovation\-driven environment, love building and deploying cutting\-edge AI solutions, and want to push the boundaries of what’s possible, this is your moment.  

Genpact (NYSE: G) is an advanced technology services and solutions company that delivers lasting value for leading enterprises globally. Through our deep business knowledge, operational excellence, and cutting\-edge solutions – we help companies across industries get ahead and stay ahead. Powered by curiosity, courage, and innovation, our teams implement data, technology, and AI to create tomorrow, today. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook.
Inviting applications for the role of Lead Consultant – Contract Compliance \& Operationalization Analyst
In this role, as part of the P2P Transformation program, the role will be supporting the team for driving enablement of Catalogs and buying channels in Ariba. The role would split their time between driving BAU continuous process improvement and participating in transformational projects to deliver better user experience and efficiency across the entire Source to Pay process.
Responsibilities* Collaborate with category managers to ensure active contracts are properly structured and migrated into Ariba.
* Define contract templates, metadata requitements, and repository strategy for contract management
* Support contract clauses library alignment and workflow automation
* Ensure all operational contracts supports guided buying and preferred supplier strategy
* Collaboratively work with other workstreams to optimize the transformation
* Challenge the team to ensure efficient, resilient design of the solutions \- keeping a view on the big picture and alignment on the core design/model
* Build the bridge between category strategy and system deployment, ensuring accurate contract integration.
* Support in preparing the implementation plan with input from senior stakeholders to actively build roadmap and ensure program/business are aware of all upcoming deliverables
* Establish and maintain effective senior stakeholder engagement demonstrating value to business partners through collective collaboration
* Leverage deep subject matter expertise to drive innovative solutions for stakeholders


Qualifications we seek in you!  

Minimum Qualifications* Strong functional understanding of end\-to\-end Source to Pay (S2P) processes such as category management, content enablement, CLM, Sourcing, SRM, and invoicing.
* Experience in category management or strategic sourcing
* Strong understanding of contract lifecycle, supplier onboarding, and buying practices
* Experience in SAP modules like SLP, Ariba is a plus
* Experience in process improvements and transformation programs
* Ability to drive change management and communication to enable transformation agenda
* Ability to work effectively under pressure, multi task, lead through ambiguities, influence where he/she does not have direct authority \& build on unstructured formative situations
* Experience in Sourcing \& Contracting experience in SAP Ariba
* Proficiency in excel macros / Power query is a must
* SAP Certified Associate \- Implementation Consultant \- SAP Ariba Contracts \- Validates knowledge of creating contract workspaces, team management, clause library, and contract approval processes.
* Focuses on automating procurement adherence, using analytics for contract compliance, and integrating contracts with Procure\-to\-Pay processes.
* Technical Skills: Knowledge of SAP Ariba APIs, data import/export (Master Data Manager), and middleware configuration (SAP Integration Suite, managed gateway) to sync contracts with SAP S/4HANA.
* Effective communication skills, including presenting and influencing senior management.
* In\-depth knowledge of the drivers of businesses performance and relevant key performance measures of Banking business
* Comfortable dealing with incomplete information, uncertainty, change and dealing with ambiguities
* Initiative and proactive thinking.

  

Preferred Qualifications/ Skills  

* Good communication and customer\-faced skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience.
  

Why join Genpact?  

* Lead AI\-first transformation – Build and scale AI solutions that redefine industries
* Make an impact – Drive change for global enterprises and solve business challenges that matter
* Accelerate your career—Gain hands\-on experience, world\-class training, mentorship, and AI certifications to advance your skills
* Grow with the best – Learn from top engineers, data scientists, and AI experts in a dynamic, fast\-moving workplace
* Committed to ethical AI – Work in an environment where governance, transparency, and security are at the core of everything we build
* Thrive in a values\-driven culture – Our courage, curiosity, and incisiveness \- built on a foundation of integrity and inclusion \- allow your ideas to fuel progress


Come join the 140,000\+ coders, tech shapers, and growth makers at Genpact and take your career in the only direction that matters: Up.  

Let’s build tomorrow together.  

  

Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.
