**500081**### **Job Description**


At Prolifics, we are currently implementing multiple solutions and we are looking to hire talented Managed Services Lead for our development centre in India. This position would be based out of Hyderabad and is a permanent position.

  

If you are looking for a high growth company with rock\-solid stability, if you thrive in the energetic atmosphere of high\-profile projects, we want to talk to you today! Let’s connect and explore possibilities of having you onboard the Prolifics team!

  

Job Title: Managed Services Lead

  

Primary Skill:Service delivery

  

Secondary Skill: Project Management

  

Location: Hyderabad

  

Educational Qualification: B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MCA/M.Sc

  

YOE: 8\+ Years

 **Job Description:**

 **Role Overview:**  


As a Managed Services Lead, you will be responsible for the strategy, delivery, and continuous improvement  


of managed services for global clients. This role demands strong leadership, operational excellence, client  


engagement, and technology understanding to ensure service excellence and long\-term client satisfaction.  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Lead end\-to\-end delivery of Managed Services for multiple accounts, ensuring SLA adherence, customer


satisfaction, and service continuity.  

* Build and maintain strong client relationships, acting as a trusted advisor on service delivery.
* Define and implement service management frameworks (ITIL\-based), governance models, and reporting


structures.  

* Collaborate with internal teams, including pre\-sales, delivery, and sales, to design managed services


offerings and solutions.  

* Drive transformation and automation initiatives for service delivery optimization.

  

Lead a global support team and manage 24x7 operations where applicable.  

* Manage budgets, cost optimization, and profitability for managed services accounts.
* Track service performance metrics and present regular reports to clients and internal leadership.
* Ensure compliance with security, risk, and quality standards.
* Contribute to continuous improvement in service processes, tools, and knowledge base.

**Required Skills \& Qualifications:**  

* 15\+ years of IT experience, with at least 7\+ years in leading Managed Services or IT Operations.
* Proven experience in managing large\-scale, multi\-technology managed services engagements.
* In\-depth knowledge of ITIL frameworks (ITIL v4 certification preferred).
* Strong understanding of cloud (Azure/AWS), infrastructure, monitoring, DevOps, and application support


models.  

* Experience working in a global delivery model with distributed teams.
* Exceptional client\-facing and communication skills.
* Strong problem\-solving, leadership, and decision\-making capabilities.
* PMP or similar project management certification is a plus.

 **About us:**

 **Prolifics Corporation Limited** is a Global Technology Solutions Provider with presence across North America (USA and Canada), Europe (UK and Germany), Middle East \& Asia. In India, we have off shore development centers: 3 in Hyderabad \& 1 in Pune.

  

For more than 40 years, Prolifics has transformed enterprises of all sizes including over 100 Fortune 1000 companies by solving their complex IT challenges. Our clients include Fortune 50 and Fortune 100 companies across a broad range of industries including Financial Services, Insurance, Government, Healthcare, Telecommunications, Manufacturing and Retail. We rank consistently in **Dream Companies to Work For** and **Dream Employer of the Year** ranking from World HRD Congress, ranked 7 in 2019\.

  

We encourage you to visit us on **www.prolifics.com** or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube and other social media to know more about us.

jobs.title: Senior Fashion Designer
jobs.description:
**SENIOR FASHION DESIGNER:** 

**Role Overview**  
We are looking for a Senior Designer to lead fashion design and merchandising strategy with a strong balance of creative direction and commercial thinking. This role will be responsible for shaping collections from concept to execution, ensuring design integrity while aligning with market demand, brand positioning, and sales performance. The ideal candidate brings a sharp design sensibility, deep knowledge of fabric and fit, and the ability to translate creative vision into scalable, high\-performing product lines.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead end\-to\-end design development across collections, from concept, moodboards, and silhouettes to final sampling and production.
* Drive merchandising strategy by curating assortments that balance brand vision, customer demand, and commercial performance.
* Collaborate with sourcing, production, and marketing teams to ensure timely delivery, quality standards, and cohesive storytelling across products.
* Oversee fit sessions, fabric selection, trims, and construction to maintain design integrity and wearability.
* Analyse product performance, customer feedback, and market trends to inform future collections and category growth.
* Mentor junior designers and interns, establish design standards, and build a strong creative culture within the team.
* Work closely with leadership to define seasonal directions, key silhouettes, and hero products.

**Requirements**

* 4–7\+ years of experience in fashion design with exposure to merchandising or product strategy.
* Strong understanding of garment construction, textiles, sourcing, and production workflows.
* Proven ability to balance creative vision with commercial viability.
* Strong sense of contemporary fashion, culture, and trend forecasting.
* Experience working with cross\-functional teams in fast\-paced environments.
* Proficiency in design tools (Adobe Suite, CAD, tech packs, etc.).
* A portfolio demonstrating both creative direction and commercially successful product design.

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹35,000\.00 \- ₹50,000\.00 per month

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Senior Salesforce Developer
jobs.description:
**Job Ad**
==========


We’re looking for an experienced **Senior Salesforce Developer** to join Procore’s Product \& Technology Team. Procore software solutions aim to improve the lives of everyone in construction and the people within Product \& Technology are the driving force behind our innovative, top\-rated global platform. We’re a customer\-centric group that encompasses engineering, product, product design and data, security and business systems.


In this **Senior** **Salesforce Developer** role, you’ll **focus on building and maintaining custom solutions on the Salesforce platform and identifying areas of improvement and automation in the Salesforce ecosystem. This role requires experience of working with Salesforce Clouds and developing solutions that leverage Salesforce AI capabilities**. You’ll partner with Business Users \& Salesforce team to **develop solutions in Salesforce Platform, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud \& CPQ**. Use your **Apex coding expertise, and problem\-solving skills** to **automate critical business processes \& enhance the Salesforce Platform**.


This position reports into **Senior Manager, Salesforce Platform** and will be based in our **Pune office**. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately. This is a hybrid role and requires working 2\-3 days from our Pune Office.


What you’ll do:

* Design, develop, test, and deploy custom Salesforce solutions using Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), Visualforce, and Salesforce Flows.
* Customize and configure Salesforce objects, fields, workflows, and processes to meet business requirements.
* Work closely with business analysts, project managers, and other stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Maintain and optimize existing Salesforce applications.
* Perform thorough code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices.
* Apply best practices while developing code \& help deploy it in Integration, Testing \& Production environments using CI/CD Tools like Copado etc.
* Integrate Salesforce with external systems using REST and SOAP APIs.
* Document technical specifications and development processes.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting for Salesforce applications.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum development methodologies.


What we’re looking for:

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* Minimum 5 years of experience as a Salesforce Developer.
* Experience in 2 or more Salesforce clouds \- Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ.
* Experience of working on Salesforce Platform \& Access Management \- User Onboarding flows, Profiles, Permissions \& Access related Automations and enhancements.
* Strong proficiency in Salesforce Platform, Apex, LWC, Visualforce, Flows.
* Understanding of Salesforce best practices and design patterns.
* Deployment using DevOps tools such as Copado, Gearset, Flosum etc.
* Experience of performing Salesforce Data Migration, using APIs and building integrations.

jobs.title: Senior Credit Analyst - Private Banking (Global Risk & Research)
jobs.description:
We are seeking an experienced professional with 2\-5 years of experience in credit risk management in Wealth Management (WM) \&Private Banking (PB) domain. The ideal candidate must be a graduate and possess strong background in credit assessment, private banking leasing, and portfolio management. This position is primarily responsible for ensuring the seamless execution of shortfall management and margin call processes, thereby safeguarding the bank//'s financial stability and mitigating potential risks.
**Key Roles \& Responsibilities** Shortfall Management and Margin Call Process
The analyst will ensure that shortfall management and margin call processes are executed accurately and timely, aligning with the bank//'s policies and regulatory requirements. This involves alerting First Line stakeholders of shortfall accounts, agreeing to remediation plans, raising to local Credit team if extension is required and work with First Line Managers in execution of sell down as required. Monitor and manage credit risks associated with shortfall accounts and margin calls, ensuring timely identification and mitigation of potential risks. Conduct thorough risk assessments and provide recommendations to mitigate identified risks, enhancing the overall risk management framework.

Support to Credit Risk Officers
The analyst will provide comprehensive support to Credit Risk Officers in various aspects of credit risk management. This includes assisting in the follow\-up with First Line on timely credit application submissions, follow up with First Line on compliance to approved credit conditions, monitoring facility limit excesses, overseeing concentration risk etc. The analyst will act as a liaison between the Private Banking Credit Risk team and other First Line stakeholders to facilitate smooth operations and effective risk management.

Reporting and Governance
The analyst will be responsible for conducting detailed internal and external reporting for the Private Bank Credit team. This includes preparing Committee packs submissions, Risk appetite reporting, Credit portfolio reporting, and regulatory submissions. The role requires a keen eye for detail and the ability to compile and present complex data in a clear and concise manner, ensuring that all reports meet the highest standards of accuracy and compliance. Ensure all credit risk management activities comply with the bank’s policies, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices. Support a culture of compliance, risk awareness, and proactive risk management with fellow stakeholders and business partners.
  

Process improvement
Provide inputs on strategies for effective shortfall management and margin call processes to safeguard the bank//'s financial stability. Provide strategic insights and recommendations to enhance credit risk monitoring and reporting processes. Support the business by ensuring timely and accurate execution of credit\-related processes, thereby enabling smooth operations and client satisfaction. Collaborate with First Line stakeholders to address and resolve shortfall accounts, ensuring remediation plans are in place and executed. Act as a liaison between the Private Bank Credit Risk team and First Line stakeholders to facilitate effective communication and coordination.

**Essential**MBA/CA/CFA Credit‑analysis expertise \- 3‑5 years of hands‑on experience evaluating high‑net‑worth client loan requests, including unsecured personal loans. Skilled at financial statement analysis, cash‑flow modelling, covenant monitoring and risk‑rating across diverse asset classes (real‑estate, equities, alternative investments, and business ownership). Regulatory \& compliance acumen \- Strong working knowledge of private‑banking regulatory frameworks such as KYC/AML, CDD, EDD, bank secrecy act (BSA) and local fair‑lending rules. Maintain documentation standards for secured and unsecured lending and ensure adherence to internal audit and compliance checklists. Communication \& stakeholder management \- Excellent written and oral communication skills; able to translate complex financial concepts into clear recommendations for clients, relationship managers, and senior risk officers. Skilled at listening to client needs, diagnosing business problems, and proposing tailored wealth management solutions. Independent, high\-pressure performance \- Proven track record of delivering accurate credit assessments and compliance checks under tight timelines with minimal supervision, ensuring timely decision making for high value private banking transactions.

jobs.title: Senior Building Manager
jobs.description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.
  
  

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.
  
  

Provide a comprehensive Property Management service to ensure that all amenities are resourced and maintained to high class industry standard.
  
Ensure all services are performed as per Standard Service Specifications
  
Preparation of Property management budgets.
  
Manage the budget efficiently and yield cost savings where possible without compromising quality of service.
  
Maintain site accommodation and services, through contractors and direct labour, in most cost effective way.
  
Ensures occupancy of site complies with statutory legislation.
  
Ensure quality of staff, appraising and developing them to ensure maximum contribution.
  
Proactive liaison with local and Haryana municipal authorities.
  
Interviews, selection, hiring, supervising and reviewing qualified building operation and management staff.
  
Manages critical relationships with client, occupants, and key vendors.
  
Reviews all building financial data.
  
Ensures that all client deliverables are submitted in a timely manner.
  
Acts as the liaison to local community public interest groups.
  
Manages vendor relationships.
  
Ensures that entire staff maintains a critical eye on all aspects of building physical care.
  
Fosters and maintains a “Occupant is our Guest” philosophy among the staff.
  
Ensure that company policies and procedures are consistently applied to required standards.
  
Assist with the management / Vendor for major internal and external works along with the relevant surveyor or relevant professional consultant.
  
Liaise with local councils and government bodies and police to adhere to relevant regulations.
  
Manage hard and soft copy data and e\-mails and ensure all client files are updated.
  
Deal with flat owners / tenants queries verbally and in written form.
  
Manage on\-site staff and associated relevant employment issues.
  
Carry out regular site visits to ensure all buildings are in good order.
  
Circulate information to occupants concerning management issues.
  
Ensure Health \& Safety regulations are adhered to and that General and Fire risk assessment recommendations are implemented across the team.
  
Review and agree all circular \& client correspondence including newsletters ensuring that communication is regular
  
Quickly resolves emergency maintenance issues.
  
Facilitate learning and development for all the team members of the department.
  
Looking for Building Manager for Commercial Property
  
**Qualifications:** B.Tech / B.E / Diploma (Electrical Engineering)
  
**Experience :** 8\+ Years of experience
  
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
  
  

Personalized benefits that support personal well\-being and growth:
  
  

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.
  
  

About JLL –
  
  

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.
  
  

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
  
  

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

jobs.title: Senior Engineer(NextJS/ReactJS)
jobs.description:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer (React.js / Next.js)

Location: Hyderabad, Telangana

Experience: 2 \- 5 years

Employment Type: Full\-time

Education

UG: B.Tech/B.E. in Any Specialization

PG: Any Postgraduate

About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Software Engineer (Frontend) to join our product engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a strong focus on building responsive, user\-friendly, and scalable web applications using modern front\-end technologies, such as ReactJS, NextJS, Ant Design, and JavaScript. You will work closely with cross\-functional teams, including designers, back\-end developers, and product managers, to create high\-quality applications that meet business requirements and provide excellent user experiences.

Key Responsibilities:

Front\-End Development:

* Design, develop, and maintain dynamic, responsive, and high\-performance web applications using ReactJS, NextJS, Ant Design, Redux, MUI, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code adhering to industry best practices and coding standards.
* Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.

Component Architecture \& Reusability

* Develop reusable UI components and libraries for scalability and efficiency.
* Implement designs using Ant Design or other design frameworks to ensure a consistent look and feel across all applications.

User Experience (UX) and Interface (UI)

* Collaborate with designers and stakeholders to translate design wireframes into functional, interactive applications.
* Ensure applications are user\-friendly and accessible, adhering to UX/UI best practices and accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG compliance).

Security \& Data Protection

* Implement robust front\-end security practices, such as data encryption, CSRF/XSS protection, and secure authentication flows.
* Work proactively to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities within the front\-end codebase.

Plugin \& System\-Level Integration

* Handle seamless integration of third\-party plugins and libraries to enhance application functionality.
* Modify and manage system\-level configurations, such as camera handling, microphone usage, and other hardware or browser API\-based functionalities.
* Ensure compliance with privacy regulations when dealing with system\-level data or permissions.

Collaboration \& Communication

* Work closely with back\-end developers to integrate APIs and ensure seamless communication between front\-end and back\-end systems.
* Collaborate with product managers to understand requirements and deliver solutions that align with business goals.
* Mentor junior developers, conduct code reviews, and provide constructive feedback.

Testing \& Debugging

* Conduct thorough testing of applications, including UI testing, unit testing, integration testing, and performance testing.
* Debug and resolve front\-end issues promptly.

Continuous Improvement

* Stay up\-to\-date with emerging trends and technologies in front\-end development, ensuring the use of modern tools and practices.
* Continuously optimize the development process and improve code quality through automation and other tools.

Required Qualifications:

Technical Skills:

* Front\-End Frameworks: Strong expertise in ReactJS, NextJS, Bootstrap and Ant Design.
* Web Technologies: Proficient in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6\+).
* State Management: Experience with Redux, Context API, or similar state management libraries.
* APIs: Familiarity with integrating RESTful APIs into front\-end applications.
* Version Control: Proficient with Git and version control workflows.
* Security: Strong knowledge of front\-end security best practices, including authentication, encryption, and secure data handling.

Experience:

* Professional Background: 2\-5 years of experience in front\-end development, with a proven track record of building and delivering production\-grade applications.
* Responsive Design: Hands\-on experience creating responsive and adaptive designs for multiple screen sizes and devices.
* Cross\-Browser Compatibility: Expertise in ensuring cross\-browser and cross\-platform compatibility.

Soft Skills:

* Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: ₹500,000\.00 \- ₹1,200,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Experience:

* React and Next js: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Senior Operations Executive New
jobs.description:
**WHAT WE DO MATTERS:**



At The Knot Worldwide, we champion celebration \- and that starts with celebrating our people. Our employees are passionate dreamers, thoughtful doers, and lifelong learners who power meaningful moments for millions around the world. We’re united by authentic connection, shared purpose, and a deep commitment to the global community we serve. Here, flexibility and belonging go hand in hand with high performance. Driven by our core values, we believe the best ideas come from empowered teams: those who consistently collaborate with intention to design solutions, spark ideas, and drive impact. Our people are at the heart of our success.


**Who are we:**



Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters.In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life’s milestones.



From the proposal to creating a home and starting a family together, we’re there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.


**About the Job:**



The GlobalEnrichment team is a process support function to our sales team to improve the efficiency of our vendor data\-set. The team works to leverage information by updating the existing vendor particulars and taking responsibility for sourcing potential new vendors from various platforms. The objective is to enhance the total addressable market.


**Here’s what you’ll do day\-to\-day:**



* Ensure 100% completion in daily executed tasks while maintaining an accuracy rate of 100%


* Prioritize efficiency to maximise daily task output.


* Assess business details for accuracy and completeness.


* Ensure consistency with platform standards and categorisation guidelines


* Rectify discrepancies and update missing details before it flows into the sales queue


* Utilize online sources such as business websites, social media, and directories to collect accurate data


* Cross\-check and validate information to ensure credibility and relevance


* Provide feedback on workflow improvements to enhance data management efficiency



**Here’s what we are looking for:**


* Educational Qualification: Bachelor's Degree; with relevant work experience would be preferred
* Work Experience: 1\-2 years of experience (Operations\-related)
* Key Skills:
* + Stellar research skills and detail\-oriented
	+ Someone who comes with a strong sense of initiative and enthusiasm
	+ Great team player who loves to see the entire team winning together

  


  

**WORK MODEL:**



This role is Together@TKWW\-eligible and based near one of our office hubs. You’ll be expected to work in the office **two days a week** as part of our hybrid work model.

  



At The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job. Together, we have an incredible opportunity to make it even easier for our customers to plan life’s most meaningful moments and for our small business owners to grow and scale. We would love to have you with us on our journey.


**WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:**


* **Commit to our customers**: You act as one team on behalf of our customers. You lead with head and heart, and build what matters for life's most meaningful moments.
* **Raise the bar:** You define "great" and work backwards. You don't just accept how it's been done, but boldly define how it should be. You are unafraid to innovate, learn, and keep moving forward toward our shared vision.
* **Be all in:** You believe in our mission and take ownership of your work. You debate openly to reach the best outcomes, speaking with clarity and care, embracing diverse perspectives, then commit fully.
* **Celebrate impact:** You measure success by the outcomes you create. You hold yourself accountable to delivering value, while recognizing progress and the lessons learned along the way. You love to win, together.


**WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:**



We believe in a wide range of holistic offerings to support our employees so that they can live our values day in and day out. From mental wellbeing, physical health and financial planning, to engaging perks and discounts, we are in the business of celebrating and supporting the Moments that Matter, both in and out of the office.. We offer flexible vacation, generous parental leave, and prioritize initiatives that support the growth, development, and happiness of our people.


**Together@TKWW is our approach to hybrid work.** It’s designed to support how we work best: combining the flexibility we value with meaningful opportunities to connect in person. Whether a role is Together@TKWW\-eligible or not, we believe in purposeful moments to come together, build strong relationships, and drive bold ideas forward.
* **For Together@TKWW\-eligible roles,** this includes regular in\-office time to foster collaboration and connection.
* **For roles not eligible for in\-office expectations**, we support connection through virtual collaboration and intentional gatherings.


To facilitate in\-person collaboration, we have office spaces in Barcelona, Spain; Delhi, India; Galway, Ireland; London, England; New York, NY; and Washington, D.C.



\_\_


**US Notice:** The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.  

  

**Privacy Notice:** The Knot Worldwide (TKWW) processes your personal data to evaluate your application, based on the legal ground of taking steps prior to entering into a potential employment contract. jobs.title: Hiring for Production Manager – Jewellery Manufacturing*
jobs.description:
**Company Description**  

We are an end to end web solution services company who believe that if our clients can envision their goal, we can make their vision a reality through the web portals we design. It is our earnest endeavor to offer practical solutions with the aid of the latest technology to ensure optimal results for the sustainability of our client’s business and fulfilling its objectives. We deliver an array of services including website designing, mobile application development, graphic designing, end to end content writing, internet marketing, and social media management to name a few.

 **Job Description**  

Job Title: Production Manager – Jewellery Manufacturing\*  

\*Location:\* Somajiguda, Hyderabad  

\*Experience:\* Minimum 5 years in jewellery manufacturing/production management  

\*Salary:\* Competitive, based on experience \+ Incentives  

\*Employment Type:\* Full\-time


\#\#\# \*Job Overview:\*


Vithaldas Jewellers, a prestigious jewellery brand with over 100 years of legacy, is seeking an experienced \*Production Manager\* to oversee the jewellery manufacturing process. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring efficient production, maintaining quality standards, managing artisans and craftsmen, and optimizing workflow to meet customer demand.


\#\#\# \*Key Responsibilities:\*


\* \*Oversee and manage\* the entire jewellery production process, from design to final product.  

\* \*Coordinate with designers, craftsmen, and suppliers\* to ensure timely production and delivery.  

\* \*Monitor quality control\* to maintain high standards of craftsmanship and material usage.  

\* \*Ensure accurate calculations\* of gold weight, precious stones, and other material costs.  

\* \*Optimize production schedules\* to meet customer orders and deadlines efficiently.  

\* \*Supervise and train production staff\*, including karigars (artisans) and technicians.  

\* \*Manage inventory and procurement\* of raw materials such as gold, diamonds, gemstones, and tools.  

\* \*Ensure compliance\* with safety and industry regulations.  

\* \*Work closely with the sales team\* to understand customer preferences and trends.  

\* \*Implement cost\-effective strategies\* to improve efficiency without compromising quality.


\#\#\# \*Requirements:\*


\* \*Qualification:\* Bachelor's degree/diploma in Jewellery Design, Production, or related field (preferred).  

\* \*Experience:\* Minimum 5 years in jewellery manufacturing or a related field.  

\* \*Languages:\* Must know \*Hindi and Telugu\* (English is a plus).  

\* \*Skills \& Qualities:\*

* Strong knowledge of jewellery production techniques, including casting, stone setting, and finishing.
* Understanding of gold purity, diamond grading, and gemstone quality.
* Ability to manage a team of craftsmen and production staff.
* Excellent organizational and problem\-solving skills.
* Attention to detail and commitment to high\-quality standards.
* Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple projects.


\#\#\# \*What We Offer:\*


\* \*Competitive salary \+ performance\-based incentives\*  

\* \*Opportunity to work with a prestigious and reputed brand\*  

\* \*Career growth in jewellery production and management\*  

\* \*Employee discounts on jewellery\*  

\* \*A professional and collaborative work environment\*


\*How to Apply:\*  

Interested candidates can apply for the job.

  

Regards

jobs.title: Medical Service Delivery & Well-being Operations Manager - Vice President
jobs.description:
Whether you’re at the start of your career or looking to discover your next adventure, your story begins here. At **Citi**, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your skills and make a difference at one of the world’s most global banks. We’re fully committed to supporting your growth and development from the start with extensive on\-the\-job training and exposure to senior leaders, as well as more traditional learning. You’ll also have the chance to give back and make a positive impact where we live and work through volunteerism.


We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as

**Medical Service Delivery \& Well\-being Operations Manager \- Vice President** **\- Hybrid**based in Mumbai, India. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well\-being to help plan for your future.


The Medical Service Delivery and Well\-being Operations Manager is responsible for partnering with the Medical Service Clinical Lead to ensure compliance with country\-specific regulations, operational excellence of medical service execution, and adherence to occupational health reporting requirements throughout the cluster. This role involves managing multiple vendor contracts related to the delivery of clinical and well\-being services, including occupational health functions. The role may serve as the Business Activity Owner (BAO) for the third\-party relationship or collaborate closely with the BAO, the Clinical Lead, and various internal disciplines (Global Sourcing, Third Party Management, Risk and Control, Legal, Audit, and Information Security). Key responsibilities also include data and record management for on\-site clinics, budget planning and forecasting, and issue identification, risk, and control. The role requires ongoing review of vendors and expenses to identify cost savings opportunities, ensure comprehensive documentation of business practices, effective communication across geographies, and contribute to the development and maintenance of strategic business continuity plans.


Key Responsibilities

* Partner and support the Medical Service Delivery Clinical Lead in the execution of on\-site medical services.
* Collaborate with Global Sourcing to finalize Master Service Agreements (MSA) and necessary contract amendments, renewals and/or extensions.
* Lead Request for Information (RFI)/Request for Proposal (RFP) process for clinical services within the cluster.
* Review MSAs to ensure Service Level Agreements are met and adhered to.
* Support the on\-boarding and off\-boarding of non\-employees (NEMS) collaborating with medical clinics.
* Perform the BAO functions or collaborate with the BAO to for on\-going monitoring and compliance for all vendors across various streams (e.g., Marketplace, IS, INFO SEC, Third Party Information Security Assessor (TPISA), Application Vulnerability Assessment (AVA), Cross Border), as needed.
* Create and track Corrective Action Plans (CAPs) and Risk Events (REs) related to on\-site clinical and well\-being service execution.
* Serve as the Records Management Owner (RMO) for on\-site medical clinics in the cluster.
* Support execution of well\-being programs in India and collaborate with local point\-of\-contact for programs in other geographies.
* Track vendor performance evaluation and completion of satisfaction surveys.
* Manage end\-to\-end invoice processing for medical vendors, as needed.
* Facilitate internal communications to raise awareness of health events and services, and manage employee surveys to gauge satisfaction and identify improvement areas.
* Oversee regional medical budgets, focusing on accurate tracking, forecasting, and cost optimization.
* Travel to other cities/countries within the cluster as required.


Education

* Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience.


Required Qualifications and Experience

* Fluent in written and spoken English.
* 2\-5 years of experience in third\-party and vendor management.
* Experience with invoice processing and Oracle payments.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
* Excellent communication skills.
* Experience in healthcare sectors is desirable.


\-

**Job Family Group:**

Human Resources
\-

**Job Family:**


Compensation \& Benefits
\-

**Time Type:**


Full time
\-

**Most Relevant Skills**

Please see the requirements listed above.
\-

**Other Relevant Skills**

For complementary skills, please see above and/or contact the recruiter.
\-

*Citi is an equal opportunity employer, and qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

 *If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review* *Accessibility at Citi**.*

jobs.title: Cluster Clinic Head
jobs.description:
Requirements:* MDS with 3–5 years of post\-MDS experience
* Proven experience managing multiple dental clinics / centers (4\+ clinics) or experience managing a very high performing clinic
* Strong leadership, people management, and decision\-making skills
* Comfortable with targets, numbers, and performance tracking
* Experience handling complete clinic operations

* Self\-driven, confident, and able to work independently

  

Key Responsibilities:* Lead and manage multiple dental clinics within the assigned cluster
* Ensure high clinical quality, SOP adherence, and exceptional patient experience
* Drive productivity, conversions, and clinic performance
* Own end\-to\-end clinic operations including staffing, workflows, and discipline
* Mentor, guide, and review CGDs, doctors, and clinic teams

jobs.title: Engineer 3 - Java Fullstack
jobs.description:
Every career journey is personal. That's why we empower you with the tools and support to create your own success story.
Be challenged. Be heard. Be valued. Be you ... be here.
Job Summary
The Engineer, 3 is responsible to work as part of a cross\-functional team in an Agile environment and translate business challenges into effective software solutions. Key responsibilities include designing, developing, testing, configuring, and deploying high\-quality software, developing test strategies, and creating cloud environments to support the development process. Oversees full stack development initiatives throughout the SDLC, advancing frontend, backend, and UI/UX components. The role ensures that all software delivery is secure, reliable, and highly automated to support seamless and efficient financial technology systems.  

Essential Job Functions* Leverage the software development lifecycle to build and enhance scalable, secure financial technology solutions. Translate business requirements into detailed technical designs and application code. Develop design specifications, including user interface layouts, and convert them into functional, high\-quality components. Provide technical on\-call support and respond to incident inquiries. \- (15%)
* Create and execute unit tests to proactively identify and resolve issues. Conduct code reviews to identify and remediate defects, ensuring adherence to coding standards. Estimate and size work efforts based on high\-level requirements and continuously improve applications for quality, efficiency, and user experience. \- (15%)
* Lead the design and development of software solutions, aligning with business goals. Oversee the full software lifecycle, ensuring quality and timeliness. Provide technical leadership, promote best practices, and mentor the team. \- (15%)
* Enhance system performance through refactoring and modern frameworks. Lead code reviews and enforce testing practices. Resolve high\-impact defects and bottlenecks to ensure reliability and robustness. \- (15%)
* Drive UI/UX improvements for intuitive interfaces. Collaborate with teams to enhance user experience. Gather and analyze feedback to refine usability and align with business objectives. \- (15%)
* Cultivate relationships across engineering, product, and business teams to enhance collaboration and efficiency. Provide coaching and constructive feedback to peers, both formally and informally. Foster a high\-performing, inclusive environment by influencing and motivating the team to achieve business goals. Incorporate feedback to drive personal and team development. \- (15%)
* Demonstrate proficiency in at least two programming languages, ideally three, and contribute to the development or maintenance of multiple applications. Operate autonomously, providing technical supervision and mentorship to peers while showcasing strong business knowledge in financial technology and payments domains. \- (10%)

  

Minimum Qualifications* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field of study or equivalent, relevant work experience
* 8\+ years of work experience in related field (Software Development Life Cycle across Full Stack, Frontend and Backend Development and UI / UX engineering).

  

Preferred Qualifications* 12\+ years of work experience in related field (Software Development Life Cycle across Full Stack, Frontend and Backend Development and UI / UX engineering).

  

Skills* JavaScript
* Microsoft Azure Functions
* Microsoft Azure SQL
* Java
* Full Stack Development
* DevOps
* AWS Development
* React.js
* Agile Methodology
* Angular

  

Reports To: Manager and above  

  

Direct Reports: 0  

  

Work Environment* Normal office environment, hybrid. On\-call rotation to include evenings or weekends.


Other Duties
This job description is illustrative of the types of duties typically performed by this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive listing of each and every essential function of the job. Because job content may change from time to time, the Company reserves the right to add and/or delete essential functions from this job at any time.
About Bread Financial®
At Bread Financial, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, give back to your community, and be part of our award\-winning culture. We’ve been consistently recognized as a best place to work nationally and in many markets and we’re proud to promote an environment where you feel appreciated, accepted, valued, and fulfilled—both personally and professionally. Bread Financial supports the overall wellness of our associates with a diverse suite of benefits and offers boundless opportunities for career development and non\-traditional career progression.
Bread Financial® (NYSE: BFH) is a tech\-forward financial services company that provides simple, personalized payment, lending and saving solutions to millions of U.S. consumers. Our payment solutions, including Bread Financial general purpose credit cards and savings products, empower our customers and their passions for a better life. Additionally, we deliver growth for some of the most recognized brands in travel \& entertainment, health \& beauty, jewelry and specialty apparel through our private label and co\-brand credit cards and pay\-over\-time products providing choice and value to our shared customers.  

Bread Financial proudly marks 30 years of success in 2026\. To learn more about our global associates, our performance and our sustainability progress, visit breadfinancial.com or follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn.* All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of credit and background checks.
* Bread Financial is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Cust Exp Manager
jobs.description:
As a Customer Experience Manager here at Honeywell, (internally titled Customer Experience Manager) you will be responsible for managing and improving the overall customer experience, ensuring that our customers have exceptional interactions with our products, services, and brand. Your role will involve analyzing customer feedback, identifying pain points, and implementing strategies to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty. By effectively managing the customer experience function, you will contribute to enhancing our reputation as a customer\-centric organization and driving business growth.


  
**Position Purpose/Summary**
----------------------------

**Key Roles and responsibilities:**

* This is a Business Operations Leader position to lead preparation and creation of Proposal and Project documentation in response to customer’s requests for proposals, estimates and information as advised by the sales and operations teams of respective LOB
* End to End responsibility to drive Post Order activities from order booking in SAP to delivery to customers for Honeywell Marine which is a part of Terminals\-PMC Business. This includes project management responsibilities
* Close coordination with internal Sales, R\&D, GCC, ISC, Commercial \& Finance as well working closely with Customer for manufacturing Clearances, deliverables, Inspections Co\-ordination, Payment Collections.
* Sense of urgency: Timelines are crucial for Order execution \& candidate must work closely with respective stake holders for timely deliverables.
* Sharing Timely Inputs to business Leader \& delivering Revenue Plans as per AOP target set.
* Close Coordination with Internal Team \& Externally with customer to meet deliverables is crucial.
* Drive productivity improvement at operations and support cost Optimization initiatives
* Lead by example on compliance matters and ensure process are set in place to get team adhere to the same
* Project management of large and highly technical projects working with multi\-disciplinary teams
* Contribute to product roadmaps, support tech teams for offering roadmaps and business continuity
* Technically savvy with the ability to create alternative solutions using both Honeywell products and 3rd party to meet scope of supply
* Close Coordination with sub vendor for timely deliverables wherever applicable.
* Need to establish healthy \& incremental customer engagement for on time deliverables.
* Jointly responsible along with general manager on monthly and quarterly performance interms of Rev, profitability and customer satisfaction working closely with factories at China and Europe operations, planning and ISC leaders to prioritize, optimize
* Drive customer satisfaction working closely with TAC and Services teams, ensure warranty costs are under control
* Responsible for all business operations of PMC\-Marine, spread across multiple local and global functions such as finance, C2C, Legal, Contract Management
* Lead all tactical and functional aspects of proposal management and services across PMC\-Marine Business
* Cross\-functional collaboration throughout regional sales, proposal management and project operations processes to ensure alignment with overall business delivery and operations model
* Promote standardization across the estimation \& proposal process
* Proposal Request, payment achievement and contract terms review/oversight ( LC / bank guarantee)
* PMC Marine technology team, Solution Architect and Offering management
* 3rd party scope and cost analysis, working with Channel partners and system integrators, Business development and Attending technical clarification meetings with customers , overseeing quality challenges
* Supporting offering management and Tech with obsolescence issues
* Candidate should be self starting \& relevant experience in Post Order Operations Function.

**Professional Skills / Knowledge**
-----------------------------------

* Good knowledge of products and solutions within Industrial Automation market, and field instrumentation, Marine, measurement domain
* "One Honeywell" knowledge , especially offerings related to Marine products , FI, GDS , PLC and Experion , VRCS, versatilis etc
* Grow PLC implementation into marine projects , FPSO offerings and other tanker applications like GDS and VRCS
* Demonstrated Growth oriented mindset
* Understands the unique value proposition of Honeywell’s offering
* Better application understanding for ease of solution offering.
* Better communication skills for internal \& External requirements.
* Improve Operation Efficiency \& bringing in Productivity at every stage of Order Execution.
* A well\-developed sense of the customers business and their drivers
* Good knowledge of competitors’ solutions, value propositions, market strategies and position

**Key Success Factors (Key Metrics / KPIs / Deliverables)**
-----------------------------------------------------------

* On time delivery and cycle time of proposals/Proposal
* Support to meet regional LOB order growth goal
* Support the general manager with Rev maximization \& Margin expansion efforts

**Behavior Competencies**
-------------------------

**Analysis/Problem Assessment**

* Securing relevant information and identifying key issues and relationships from a base of information; relating and comparing data from different sources; identifying cause\-effect relationships.

**Building Business Partnerships**

Using appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods to work with business partners (e.g. peers, other departments or units, external vendors, customer’s, other organizations etc.) to meet mutual goals and objectives.


**Communication**

Expressing ideas effectively in individual and group situations (including non verbal communication); adjusting language or terminology to the characteristics and needs of the audience.


**Commercial Acumen**

Taking action to maximize the contribution of own area of the business to the company’s profitability and growth. This involves constantly looking for opportunities to improve business performance and growth; managing business operations to maintain ongoing competitive advantage; taking business decisions based on cost benefit analysis, business savvy and consideration of organizational constraints and resources.


**Customer Service Orientation**

Proactively developing customer relationships; making efforts to listen and to understand the customer (both internal and external); anticipating and providing solutions to customer needs; giving high priority to customer satisfaction.


**Financial Acumen**

Taking financial action to maximize the contribution of own area of the business to the company’s profitability and growth. This involves analyzing financial information to develop alternative courses of action, establishing financial systems and procedures to improve business performance and reduce costs, establishing financial strategies to leverage organizational assets and promote growth and making decisions based on sound financial judgement.


**Results Orientation**

Indicating through actions and decisions a sense of importance to get the job done; focusing on the most important things; being impatient with obstacles and lack of movement; taking action to overcome obstacles and seek solutions.


  
YOU MUST HAVE


* Minimum 15\&\#43;years of experience in handling Estimation, Project operations Operations or Project management within PMC offerings
* BE\- Mechanical/ Instrumentation/ Electronics is preferred
* Certified Course within Operations/ Project Management will be added advantage.

  
Honeywell helps organizations solve the world's most complex challenges in automation, the future of aviation and energy transition. As a trusted partner, we provide actionable solutions and innovation through our Aerospace Technologies, Building Automation, Energy and Sustainability Solutions, and Industrial Automation business segments – powered by our Honeywell Forge software – that help make the world smarter, safer and more sustainable.

jobs.title: Sr HR Officer
jobs.description:
**Job Title:** Senior HR Officer  
**Location:** Supa  
**Department:** Human Resources  
**Reporting To:** HR Manager / Plant Head

About the Company

**Japfa Comfeed India Pvt Ltd** is one of the largest and most integrated agri\-food companies in India.  
The company’s core business activities include animal feed manufacturing, chicken breeding, poultry processing, and aquaculture farming. Japfa’s strong vertical integration and economies of scale enable it to deliver superior quality at every stage of the value chain—from feed to value\-added food products. The organization aims to establish itself as a leading integrated food company in India by expanding into value\-added and consumer\-branded food segments.

**Position Summary**

The Senior HR Officer – Supa will be responsible for managing end\-to\-end HR operations at the site. The role focuses on recruitment, induction and onboarding, attendance management, employee grievance handling, administration\-related activities, and effective implementation of HR policies and processes.

Key Responsibilities Recruitment \& Manpower Planning

* Handle end\-to\-end recruitment activities for plant and support functions, including sourcing, screening, interview coordination, and offer processing.
* Coordinate with department heads to understand manpower requirements and timelines.
* Maintain recruitment records and trackers.

Induction \& Onboarding

* Plan and conduct employee induction and orientation programs.
* Ensure smooth onboarding of new employees, including documentation, joining formalities, and system updates.
* Coordinate with departments to facilitate role\-specific training and integration.

Attendance \& HR Operations

* Manage and monitor employee attendance, leave records, and shift data.
* Ensure accuracy of attendance data for payroll processing and statutory compliance.
* Maintain and update employee master data and personnel files.

Employee Grievance Handling \& Employee Relations

* Act as the first point of contact for employee grievances.
* Address and resolve employee concerns in a fair and timely manner.
* Support disciplinary processes in line with company policies and statutory requirements.
* Promote a positive and productive work environment at the Supa location.

Administration \& Facility Coordination

* Handle HR\-related administrative activities such as ID cards, access control, travel support, and coordination with facility and security teams.
* Support site\-level administrative requirements as assigned by management.

HR Policies, Compliance \& Other HR Activities

* Ensure implementation and adherence to company HR policies and procedures.
* Support statutory and labor compliance requirements at the site.
* Assist in audits, inspections, and internal reviews related to HR and labor matters.
* Support employee engagement initiatives, welfare activities, and communication programs.
* Carry out any other HR\-related responsibilities assigned by the reporting manager from time to time.

Qualification \& Experience

* Graduate / Post\-Graduate in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
* 2–4 years of relevant HR experience, preferably in manufacturing, food processing, or industrial environments.
* Prior experience in handling plant/site HR operations will be an added advantage.

Key Skills \& Competencies

* Strong knowledge of recruitment processes and HR operations.
* Working knowledge of labor laws and statutory compliance.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to handle employee grievances and sensitive situations professionally.
* Strong coordination, documentation, and administrative skills.
* Ability to work independently at a site location and manage multiple priorities.

Work Location

* Supa Location

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹20,000\.00 \- ₹30,000\.00 per month

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Leave encashment
* Provident Fund

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: GoTo Group - Senior Product Manager - Data Foundation
Sr. Cluster Manager
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Job description: Are you interested in being part of a brand new Amazon initiative to redefine the way customer delivery takes place and to delight our customers and take your skills and career to the next level? Join the Last Mile Analytics and Quality (LMAQ) team which will work to establish new approaches to seamlessly curate and enhance data from Amazon’s global last mile delivery network to improve our geo\-spatial data quality.
  

We are seeking a passionate, experienced operations manager to lead our image audit programs in Hyderabad, India.
  

\[S]he will be primarily responsible for
  

* Devise operational and business goals for the function that focuses on end\-customer impact, productivity, accuracy, and speed to market.
* Establishes measurement, reporting and process excellence indicators for effective accomplishment of goals in core processes. Manages metric performance tactically and strategically;
* Sets appropriate operational and people goals for the team at all levels and holds them accountable; Owns processes, staffing, metrics and business updates for the function.
* Thinks long\-term and establishes scalable/modular processes for easy adaptation to business scope changes. Manages complex problems, decisions, and escalations. Mitigates long\-term risks. Finds a path forward in difficult situations. Makes trade\-offs: short vs. long\-term needs.
* Proactively identifies tool and system requirements that reduce operational defects; Ensures impact\- and benefit\-driven prioritization of process excellence projects.
* Works with inter\-functional teams to streamline processes. Identifies and drives process excellence along with Program and Tech teams.


  

The ideal candidate will be organized, detail\-oriented, and clearly communicate progress. \[S]he contributes to data quality improvement projects by proposing enhancements to tools and working on continuous improvement of business process that address key team pain\-points to set them up for success. The person is a self\-starter, set vision and manages teams and sets clear goals for team performance management. The person has track record of driving process excellence. Knowledge or experience in Six sigma, LEAN, DMAIC, Kaizen and/or statistical process control projects is a bonus.  

  

  

  

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 2\+ years of employee and performance management experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent, or 2\+ years of Amazon (blue badge/FTE) experience
* Work a flexible schedule/shift/work area, including weekends, nights, and/or holidays

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* 1\+ years of performance metrics, process improvement or lean techniques experience

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\-we\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

jobs.title: Digital & IT Manager- Region Asia
jobs.description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next\-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Ready to shape tomorrow’s society together with us?**

  

Our world is a world of change.

  

Our organization is based on people and great teamwork. We are a truly global company, we rely on diversity and together we create a workplace that brings the best out of everyone.

 **This is us, your new colleagues**

  

Here at Volvo CE\- Digital \& IT, we are driven by the idea that through imagination, hard work and technological innovation we will lead the way towards developing a world that is cleaner, smarter and more connected.

  

We believe in a sustainable future and with the global construction industry as our arena, we work together with our customers to turn this belief into reality for people everywhere. That is our purpose, and we live and breathe it, every day. With that, we are “Building Tomorrow”!

  

Do you want to be a part of building the world we want to live in?

  

Right now we are looking for a **Digital \& IT Manager** to work with dealers, customers and stakeholders in Region Asia.

 **Mission:**

  

As Digital \& IT manager, you will be part of a team that will be supporting Region Asia and Region India in defining and implementing our future roadmap \& play a pivotal role in driving the digital transformation/managing the IT for dealer and customer\-facing applications.

  

This position will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of digital strategy, implementation and IT operations related to enhancing the dealer and customer experience through innovative digital solutions.

  

Overall we use our business strategy to drive 3 main areas:

  

* Implementation of AI in daily business processes.
* Implement new global solutions / processes
* Update our overall local digital strategy
* Proactively look for improvement in our current processes and solutions.

 **This is how you could make an impact:**

  

* You are hands\-on with Agentic AI \& prompt engineering.
* You have experience in seamless communication, presentation skills and project management.
* You have proven track in implementing complex solution architectures.
* You have driven or been involved in project handled in an agile approach.
* You have good understanding of sales and marketing business processes.
* You will drive digitization and automation for enhancing overall process.
* You will provide leadership for planning, developing and implementing ad hoc requests from customers.
* You'll provide task and project updates with concise meaningful communications via presentations and email.
* You will support business in prioritization of scope and in selecting/designing optimal Digital \& IT solutions based on Stakeholder and end user needs. At more senior levels hold process specializations to act as domain experts.
* You will work in pre\-studies \& project for one time delivery.
* You will demonstrate excellent solution understanding, combined with related process knowledge and solution dependencies/interfaces.
* You will understand the business context and provide solutions by having a proactive approach to solutions to the stakeholders
* You will be responsible for managing the solution(s) in partnership with Senior Business \& Process Stakeholders.
* You have knowledge of digitalization and have transformed businesses.

 **Personal \& Soft skills:**

  

* Flexible and able to adapt to changing conditions
* Good facilitation and presentation skills
* Comfortable to engage with senior leaders and subject experts
* Mindset of try and learning of mistakes
* Self driven
* Good communication skills both direct and virtual
* Team player
* Creative and active listening

 **The following qualifications are required:**

  

* Predictive Modelling \& Forecasting
* Prompt Engineering
* Machine Learning
* MySQL \& Javascript development
* Version Control \& CI/CD (Git, MLflow)
* Prior experience in sales \& marketing business processes is a benefit.
* Active member in core team for transformation projects.
* Have been part of cross functional teams from cultural and domain perspective.
* Open minded and flexible.

  

In preparation our discussion, we would appreciate if you consider the following questions in your application/cover letter:

  

* What is the bravest decision you have taken in the last 6 months?
* Describe your most successful collaboration the last year?
* Describe our future digital landscape (in 5 year) and our opportunities in that scenario?

 **Curious, and have some questions? Call us!**


Mohsin Sarvar, Head of Digital \& IT\- Region Asia


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

Part of Volvo Group, **Volvo Construction Equipment** is a global company driven by our purpose to build the world we want to live in. Together we develop and deliver solutions for a cleaner, smarter, and more connected world. By unleashing everyone’s full potential, we build a more sustainable future for all our stakeholders. Come join our team and help us build a better tomorrow.

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.company: EvolutionCo Digital & Interactive Consultancy Pvt. Ltd
jobs.description:
**Location: Mumbai \[ Andheri East]**

As a Digital Account Manager, you will play a key role in ensuring seamless communication between EvolutionCo and its clients. You will assist the client servicing team in managing client relationships, coordinating projects, and ensuring the timely delivery of campaigns. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands\-on experience in client management and digital marketing.

**Role \& responsibilities**

● Manage and nurture client relationships to ensure long\-term satisfaction and retention. Serve as the main point of contact for clients, addressing inquiries and resolving issues promptly.

● Develop and implement strategic account plans to achieve client goals and drive growth.

● Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless service delivery.

● Monitor and report on account performance, providing regular updates to clients and internal stakeholders.

● Stay up\-to\-date with digital marketing trends and best practices to provide clients with informed advice and solutions.

● Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.

● 0\-5 years of experience in account management, preferably within a digital marketing agency.

● Proven track record of managing and growing client accounts.

● Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.

● Strong organizational and time\-management abilities.

● Ability to work collaboratively with cross\-functional teams.

● Proficiency in CRM software, Google Analytics, and digital marketing tools.

● Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights. Preferred Experience in Social Media, SEO, PPC, Website Development, Performance Marketing, etc

● Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies.

● Certification in Digital Marketing or Account Management.
